programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Nathan and Debb test-drive an unusual motorcycle simulator at Pickwick Pawnbrokers, while Larry and Neil look to complete deals involving a rare drum kit, a luxury set of travel bags and an antique medicine cabinet at Cashbrokers in Penzance.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Pickwick Pawnbrokers boss Nathan might have laid his hands on a fourth-century statue worth tens of thousands of pounds, while another customer is selling a rare grandfather clock.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two couples looking for somewhere to live in Buckinghamshire, where they can combine high-flying careers in the capital with peaceful small-town life for their young families. Shane and Annamarie Mugan have a budget of £850,000, but have not found their ideal home after viewing more than 50 properties, while Emma and Andrew Jarvis face tough competition as they search for a four-bedroom house with plenty of character.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Eric Casaburi, a former undercover boss, invites six other employers who also appeared incognito on the show to talk about their experiences of the programme at a restaurant. However, little do they realise that Eric is going to try to fool them by appearing as a waiter. Featuring Kat Cole, Paul Damico, Andy Wiederhorn, Sheldon Yellen, Anthony Wedo and Jane Grote Abell.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Shane Evans, COO and co-founder of massage therapy chain Massage Heights, poses as a contestant on a TV reality show who is trying fund her own business. After spending nine years moulding the company, she decides to find out first-hand how her retreats are doing so she can fix potential problems before expanding the business to 300 new locations.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The hosts check in to the Thomas Paine Hotel in Thetford, where an inappropriate book is found in a bedside drawer and competition turns fierce at a Home Guard training exercise.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Five amateur cooks from Wakefield, West Yorkshire, take turns trying to throw the perfect dinner party. Retired businesswoman Angie Battye hosts the first night and hopes her Asian roots and love of Barbadian cuisine will impress her guests. She also provides entertainment in the form of limbo dancing.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: IT expert and disco fanatic Joel Rowbottom throws the second of the week's parties in Wakefield, West Yorkshire, hoping to impress his guests with an exciting mixture of food and dance. The host faces awkward questions about his disco pants, resulting in some frank revelations, but hopes he can turn the evening's fortunes around with his `dad dancing' competition.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Donna Stephenson hopes to impress with a main course of `bunny delight' as she hosts the third dinner party from Wakefield, West Yorkshire - but her guests are distracted by the number of animals she has.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Shoeless window cleaner Jake Coxon hosts the fourth dinner party from Wakefield, West Yorkshire, hoping to impress his guests with beef Wellington, and performing his song God Is a Rocking Chair with his band the Sourheads.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Francesca Saynor hosts the final dinner party in Wakefield, hoping that her simple menu and back-to-school theme will be enough to impress her guests and make her the winner of the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help a couple with a budget of £480,000, who are expecting a baby in 12 weeks, find a home in Godalming, on Surrey's commuter belt, as quickly as possible. The property gurus also come to the aid of a fastidious pair in Guildford who are struggling to find a home for £250,000, jeopardising their marriage plans in the process.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Karen and John Leonard from Essex are close to retirement and fancy a new home in sunny Gran Canaria. Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties for their £175,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer visit Hastings to help two couples look for their dream homes. However, with extravagant ideas and limited budgets on the agenda, they have their work cut out locating suitable properties. Jakki and Scott are determined to find a house before the arrival of their baby, while newlyweds Chris and Nicola want a two-bedroom family home in a great location.(n)

programme.title: Who Wants My Council House
programme.desc: Documentary following five households looking to swap their council house. Some want to upgrade to their ideal home, others simply fancy a change of scenery and some are parents seeking to downsize now that their children have flown the nest. However, council house swaps do not involve estate agents with sharp sales patter. It is up to the tenants to show each other around their homes and do the hard sell. If the first viewing goes well, there will be an invitation for a return viewing before both sides decide whether to swap - or not.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Benefit Tenants
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of specialist letting agencies. Manchester agent Joe is caught between a single mother struggling to pay off her rent arrears and a landlord who has run out of patience. But unknown to Joe, his tenant has a plan to get herself out of this mess she has found herself in. Across town, letting agent Tracy is in for a shock when she discovers one of her tenants has turned a bedroom into an aviary full of tropical birds.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: People who risk ruining their own lives for the sake of a night out, including a professional footballer almost triple the legal drink drive limit while on his way to training after drinking heavily the night before. In Crewe, PCs Vicky Howell and Greg Greaves get an eyeful on their Saturday night patrol as they stop a man walking along a main road, naked from the waist down. He doesn't know where his trousers are and it's down to the police to make sure he gets home safely.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Nahida from Liverpool is searching for a man who shares her passion for food, and her date is with fellow Liverpudlian Thomas, who describes himself as a loveable bear. Ex-cruise ship worker Dale, 46, has been single for five years since his partner passed away, but is now ready to put his faith in Cupid again, and his date is 39-year-old massage therapist Chris.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the words-and-numbers game, with Jon Richardson and Jonathan Ross taking on guest captain Lee Mack and Victoria Coren Mitchell. Jessie Cave joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Is Love Racist? The Dating Game
programme.desc: Sociologist and broadcaster Emma Dabiri looks at racism in Britain through the world of modern dating, unveiling the results of a national survey of British online dating habits. A volunteer group of young British singletons take part in a series of experiments to discover if there's more than meets the eye going on in the flighty world of modern dating apps. Emma also meets a number of controversial interviewees - from Mobo-award-winning rapper Nadia Rose, through to BAME equal opportunities campaigner Baroness McGregor-Smith.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits a dog-friendly hotel in West Dover, Vermont, that is in urgent need of help. Owner Sandy MacDougall runs the Four Seasons Inn like a hostel, with unpaid staff staying in the rooms instead of paying guests. The acerbic chef aims to get the business back on track before Sandy loses everything, but wonders whether it would be kinder to simply put this dog-friendly hotel to sleep.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Property expert Lucy Alexander helps a couple looking to leave London behind and move to Yorkshire, and two people who are longing for peace and privacy in Kent.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps Jane and Rhys move closer to the big-city bustle of Leicestershire while still being near open spaces, and a Tunbridge Wells couple look to downsize.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: A woman appears at Cashbrokers Pawnbrokers in Penzance with an autograph book signed by stars including the Rolling Stones and Cliff Richard. At Nikolas Patrick in Kent, pawnbroking brothers Charlie and Patrick try to raise cash for a set of vintage cameras and an exclusive designer pen with a sky-high price tag.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Sheffield pawnbroker Dan values a handbag believed to once belong to Cheryl, and finds a pair of designer Tom Ford shoes that could be worth a small fortune.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer and Kirstie Allsopp return to Sheffield to check on the progress of firefighter Justin and his sales manager wife Deborah, who had been searching for their ideal family home for more than two years without success. Also in the South Yorkshire city, they revisit GP Andy and consultant therapist Artie who could not agree on the type of property they wanted to spend their £700,000 budget on.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Shane Evans, COO and co-founder of massage therapy chain Massage Heights, poses as a contestant on a TV reality show who is trying fund her own business. After spending nine years moulding the company, she decides to find out first-hand how her retreats are doing so she can fix potential problems before expanding the business to 300 new locations.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Bruce `Two Dogs' Bozsum, the chairman of a Native American gaming and entertainment empire, goes undercover among his own employees to learn how he might be able to improve his organisation and ensure it flourishes for generations to come. He poses as a reality TV contestant who is trying to win funds to start up his own business, before revealing his true identity and offering rewards to some of the memorable people he has met.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Chris and Sarah Whitehead invite their fellow hoteliers to Tenbury Wells in Worcestershire, where they open the doors of their historic pub The Rose and Crown.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Horse enthusiast Richard Negus hosts the first dinner party from Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk, focusing on a `day at the races' theme. He serves a course called Under Starter's Orders, and They're Off-al for his main course, and provides a game of snail racing for entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Business studies lecturer Amber Elba Porter hosts the second dinner party in Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk, hoping her spiritual-themed evening, complete with tarot card readings and rune stones, will win her the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Tim Reinman presents the third dinner party from Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk, but is upstaged by domestic goddess Hannah Totman, leaving spiritualist Amber Elba-Porter and hypnotherapist Sue Smith less than happy with their fellow guest. The host hopes his `Timoffee' pie will help to get the night back on track.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sue Smith hosts the fourth dinner party from Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk, and decides to organise an evening of entertainment revolving around a `back to school' theme. However, the items on her menu puzzle the guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Self-styled domestic goddess Hannah Totman hosts the final dinner party in Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk, and hopes that her Italian-themed menu and opera singing will impress her guests enough for her to win the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer heads to the Tyne Valley, near Newcastle, to help Kerry Ellis and Michael Byrne, who have a budget of £150,000 to spend on their first property, but are finding house-hunting difficult as Kerry works in Manchester. Also in the area, Kirstie Allsopp searches for a rural home with a garden suitable for David and Kate Whitehead, who are expecting their second child.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Renuka Joseph is looking for a home on the Costa del Sol, which reminds her of her native Sri Lanka, so Jasmine Harman shows her apartments in Estepona for her £80,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Professor Noel Fitzpatrick performs a risky procedure to save the life of an 18-week-old cockapoo puppy that has fractured its neck following an accident in the garden. He also comes to the aid of Romanian stray Geoffrey, who was found abandoned and emaciated before being adopted by Kent couple John and Stacey, and an accident-prone cat called MK who has fallen from a window.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A five-year-old Great Dane is rushed to Fitzpatrick Referrals after losing the use of its back legs due to a slipped disc, with complications leaving the dog fighting for its life. A woman and her two children bring their pet spaniel to the practice after it is hit by a car, and a 10-year-old collie with hip dysplasia visits the surgery.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson guides two more singletons on the dating show based naked attraction alone. First into the studio is 26-year-old Adele from Scotland. After beating cancer, Adele wants to live life to the full and find a guy who feels the same. She is followed by 22-year-old Jack from Manchester. After a dramatic four-stone weight-loss, Jack wants to show off his new body and attract the one for him.(n)

programme.title: The World's Weirdest Weather
programme.desc: Sunlight appears to transform water into liquid gold in California, a record-breaking heatwave wipes out thousands of bats in Australia, and weird weather makes sand dunes sing in the deserts of the Middle East. Plus, little-understood gravity waves captured on camera, how water can break apart rocks, why a lake in Canada is coming out in spots, and the unlucky tourist who visited the Grand Canyon, only to find the basin filled with thick fog.(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Jackie is aghast to find Kelso has been canoodling with another girl behind the gym, and takes revenge by ensuring he is not invited to a skiing break at her father's cabin. Nostalgic comedy, starring Mila Kunis and Topher Grace.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: Abby manages to find a quick replacement for cheerleader Brooke, but further changes send the mothers into uproar. Meanwhile, Brooke learns a very harsh lesson.(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show
programme.desc: Eric's grandmother dies just after he makes a throwaway comment about her, leaving him guilt-ridden. Meanwhile, Red and brother Marty fall out over more practical matters, such as how to divide up her belongings. Comedy, starring Mila Kunis and Kurtwood Smith.(n)

programme.title: Five Children and It
programme.desc: Five brothers and sisters are sent to live with their uncle in the country during the First World War. Their worries are soon forgotten when they encounter a mysterious creature who offers to grant them one wish each day. Fantasy, adapted from the classic tale by E Nesbit, with Eddie Izzard as the voice of the magical creature. Starring Kenneth Branagh, Zoe Wanamaker, Tara FitzGerald and Freddie Highmore.(n)

programme.title: Benefits Britain: Life on the Dole
programme.desc: This edition of the programme focuses on large families who depend on the benefits system, including 64-year-old Peter Rolfe, whose children - by 15 different women - range in ages from three to 43, of which he is the sole carer for six. He has been fighting his council in the Isle of Wight for a much bigger house and is also at loggerheads with the benefits office for capping his weekly payment. West Midlands mother-of-eight Marie Buchanan has recently split from her partner and is looking for a larger home, while Ipswich couple the Fisks have been in dispute with their neighbours, who objected to two houses being knocked into one to accommodate them and their 13 children.(n)

programme.title: Meet the Psychopaths
programme.desc: Professor Tony Maden looks into the personalities of `super-functional' psychopaths and explains how individuals with power can ruin the lives of millions. Extraordinary footage from Jimmy Savile's past reveals that he knew he could get away with his sexual abuse crimes, while observations from those who knew media tycoon Robert Maxwell point to a man out of control and a dangerous psychopath who ruined people's lives without a second thought. Plus, rare footage of Adolf Hitler's behaviour in private offers an insight into his rise to power.(n)

programme.title: Extraordinary People
programme.sub-title: The Bubble Wrap Boy: Extraordinary People.
programme.desc: The story of 16-year-old Mithun Chauhan, who suffers from an extremely rare genetic condition that has left him with large swollen lumps all over his face and body. His disfigurement has led to the creation of a rumour that his village has become home to a reclusive monster. The condition, known as neurofibroma, affects one in 33,000 people and causes tumours to grow along the nerve endings, with Mithun's case among the most extreme ever discovered.(n)

programme.title: Seven Pounds
programme.desc: A man haunted by a tragedy he caused seeks redemption. Assuming his tax inspector brother's identity to gain access to people's private records, he sets out to atone by helping seven seemingly unconnected strangers with their problems - only to fall in love with one of the people he assists. Drama, starring Will Smith, Rosario Dawson, Woody Harrelson and Barry Pepper.(n)

Two friends set out on a journey of self-discovery, while a career gal struggles with settling down and an uptight romantic searches for her perfect match(n)

programme.title: Man on the Moon
programme.desc: Andy Kaufman's public image changed like the weather: he was loved and hated in equal measure and his innovative style of humour was often misunderstood. He acknowledged that he didn't know what was funny or not, and his material could generate laughs and tears, silence and brawls(n)

programme.title: Michael Clayton
programme.desc: Michael Clayton handles all of the dirty work for a major New York law firm, arranging top-flight legal services and skirting through loopholes for ethically questionable clients. But when a fellow fixer decides to turn on the very firm they were hired to clean up for, Clayton finds himself at the centre of a conspiratorial maelstrom(n)

programme.title: Tetro

Vincent Gallo stars with newcomer Alden Ehrenreich, with Carmen Maura, Maribel Verdú, and Alden Ehrenreich rounding out the cast(n)

Later, she realizes that this fearsome entity is connected to her mentally ill mother, who has started hallucinating conversations with a mysterious figure named Diana(n)

programme.desc: After he inherits a yacht, Chicago businessman Martin totes his family to the Caribbean to claim it. Not having any skill at boating, he hires long-haired, one-eyed low-life Captain Ron, to pilot the heap to Miami. During the journey, the somewhat inept sailor frequently loses his way while becoming a hit with everyone in the family--except Martin. This comedy features Martin Short, Kurt Russell, Mary Kay Place, with Benjamin Salisbury and Meadow Sisto as the two children(n)

programme.desc: A slovenly sailor is stranded on a desert island with his employer, a rich, self-centered woman who is used to having her own way. Cut off from society, he reverses their roles, stripping her of pride and vanity and controlling her completely.. until she falls in love with him(n)

programme.desc: A mousy college freshman living on her own in New York City meets Brooke, her stepsister-to-be, and is soon entranced by her worldliness and flummoxed by her impulsive nature(n)

programme.title: My Fellow Americans
programme.desc: Jack Lemmon and James Garner, two masters of subtle comic timing, star in this uproarious political satire. They play ex-presidents from opposing political parties who reluctantly form an alliance after a scandal forces them to run from federal agents. Dan Aykroyd, John Heard, Sela Ward, Wilford Brimley, Lauren Bacall(n)

programme.title: The Family Man
programme.desc: Wall Street Banker Jack Campbell has it all: more cash than he can shake a stick at, oodles of power and, above all, his freedom. But on Christmas Eve he challenges an armed robber, then on Christmas Day he wakes up to the life he would have had if he'd stayed with his college girlfriend: two noisy kids, a dead-end job selling tyres, and a people carrier instead of his Ferrari. At first he's horrified..(n)

programme.title: The Arrival
programme.desc: They have been saying for years that the Greenhouse Effect is going to destroy the planet. For years humans have blamed themselves for spewing climate-changing gasses into our fragile atmosphere. But are we as guilty as we think we are or are there more sinister forces at work? Paying tribute to an old-fashioned '50s style paranoid (the aliens have come to take over the planet) sci-fi low-budget thriller, this film gives a chilling answer to that question. It begins with the scene of a young woman picking poppies in a verdant field. She is obviously puzzled and as the camera pulls away it becomes clear why. The story then jumps to a California observatory where nerdish radio telescope operator Zane Ziminski is suddenly jarred from the boredom of monitoring random space noises by a strangely regular series of unearthly blips that he is convinced come from an alien galaxy and for some reason are being deliberately beamed to Earth. Excitedly he takes the recorded evidence to his boss, who promptly fires him. Convinced that the aliens were transmitting messages to aliens already on our planet, Ziminski quickly builds a make-shift radio telescope and high tech computer system in his garage so he can pinpoit the destination of the singles. This leads him to an isolated Mexican village where he and another scientist (the lady from the poppy field), who has drawn similar conclusions, team up and go alien-hunting. They don't hunt long, for the villagers turn out to be mighty strange people. From there it is only a short time before they find the underground alien lair where they learn that the invaders' home planet is dying and that they are planning to "terraform" the Earth in preparation of colonizing it. Part of the process involves deliberately accelerating the Greenhouse effect. The special effects are well-done and refreshingly, they are not overpowering(n)

Gabriel Cash is another Los Angeles narcotics cop who has long, dishevelled blonde hair and dresses in worn-out sweatshirts. Together, Tango and Cash are the two best narcs in LA, which causes drug baron Yves Perret no end of distress(n)

Within lies millions of dollars of illegal drugs, and the divers' dream of finding sunken treasure has come true. But as they argue among themselves about what to do with their prize, the friends soon realize they're not the only ones interested in the narcotics. Dangerous criminals are also searching for the drugs, and now the treasure hunters themselves have become the hunted(n)

programme.desc: A crew on-board a battered commercial space vessel, far away in space and time, encounter a deadly alien creature(n)

programme.title: Run Fatboy Run
programme.desc: David Schwimmer's debut directorial feature stars Simon Pegg as Dennis Doyle, seen in the film's opening sequence abandoning a very pregnant Libby Odell at the altar. Five years later, he's an overweight security guard with limited access rights to their son Jake, but still holding a torch for her. When he finds she has a new boyfriend, superfit all-round jock Whit, he decides to win her back by entering the same charity marathon as Whit and beating him. With coaching from his landlord and encouragement of sorts from his friend Gordon, he sets off over the start line but has he prepared enough to make it to the finish?(n)

programme.title: Hereafter
programme.desc: Hereafter tells the story of three people who are touched by death in different ways. George is a blue-collar American who has a special connection to the afterlife. On the other side of the world, Marie, a French journalist, has a near-death experience that shakes her reality. And when Marcus, a London schoolboy, loses the person closest to him, he desperately needs answers. Each on a path in search of the truth, their lives will intersect, forever changed by what they believe might or must exist in the hereafter(n)

programme.desc: New York cop John McClane fights terrorists in an Los Angeles skyscraper in a bid to rescue his estranged wife, who happens to be one of the hostages(n)

programme.title: Everest
programme.desc: In this adventure docudrama set in 1996, several groups of climbers successfully scale Mount Everest, only to be faced with tragedy when a monster snowstorm surprises them as they attempt to make their descent(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: A New Germany (1933-1939). This video is volume one in the 26-volume World at War series that chronicles the history of World War II. Originally appearing on television in 1974, the popular show was hosted by Laurence Olivier. In this first episode, the producers show the terrible cost of the war -- worldwide devastation and the deaths of 55 million people. The program examines the politics and economy of Germany that brought forth the Nazi Party and the leadership of Adolf Hitler(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Distant War (September 1939 - May 1940). Chronicling the events that followed Britain's declaration of war against Germany. Highlights include the Russian invasion of Finland, the mining of Norwegian waters by Britain and France, and Germany's control of Norway's airfields. Also: the resignation of Prime Minister Chamberlain after the Norwegian defeat. Laurence Olivier narrates(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: France Falls (May - June 1940). Spring 1940: France falls under German attack. On film: the Maginot line, where the French wait while German Panzer divisions advance through the unprotected Ardennes forest. Parachutists invade neutral Holland, Rommel defeats the French at Sedan and the German war machine moves on to Paris. At Dunkirk, Allied troops are evacuated. Belgium capitulates. The Franco-German Armistice is signed at Compiegne. Laurence Olivier is the host(n)

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Alone (May 1940 - May 1941). After Dunkirk, Britain faces an onslaught. Although the RAF wins the Battle of Britain, cities are blitzed. Narrated by Laurence Olivier(n)

programme.desc: Hitler's Betrayal. Soviet-British relations; the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor; and plans for a Western Front in Europe are examined(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Right on the Money
programme.desc: Denise Lewis and Dominic Littlewood give advice on how to save money on holidays and days out, while the team helps a teacher trying to build a better life for her young twins.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore properties about to be auctioned in Cornwall, London and Kent, before finding out about the new owners' plans for the buildings.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Officer Dom Bryant gets an anonymous tip-off that cannabis is being grown at a house in the small village of Burnham-on-Sea, but he finds out that all is not what it seems.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville investigate health-related holiday disasters, and couples left out of pocket because of cancelled breaks due to the zika virus.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin takes the bargain hunting teams to Leominster, Herefordshire, where two teams compete to buy three items that will hopefully make the greater profit at auction. Providing a helping hand to the sides are experts Paul Laidlaw and Mark Ashley. Plus, Natasha meets Royal Worcester aficionado Henry Sandon.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Paudge's blackmail ordeal may finally be over, Garda officers pursue a new murder suspect, and the Kielys `welcome' Hennessy visitors.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman heads to Somerset to help a woman find a home in the countryside for her and her elderly mother with a £375,000 budget. While there, the presenter meets a fashion entrepreneur turned horticulturalist, who has designs on an iconic Somerset garden.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore hopes to turn some old manhole covers, two forlorn seats and an antique suit stand into hard cash after rescuing them from a Surrey tip.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: A collection of some of the best, unseen finds from the series, visiting the Milestones Museum in Basingstoke Ragley Hall in Warwickshire, the National Maritime Museum Cornwall in Falmouth, and the RAF museum in Hendon, London. Items include an art nouveau necklace and a pair of British railway lamps.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys quizzes another four famous faces on their specialist subjects. Those braving the black chair are comedian Mitch Benn, news presenter Reeta Chakrabarti, CBBC's Mark Rhodes and triathlon gold medallist Alistair Brownlee, showing what they know about Peter Cook, the life and poetry of John Keats, the World Wrestling Federation and the Yorkshire Dales.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Lauren opens up to Max about Steven's news, leaving her suspicious father doing a little digging in an attempt to get to the bottom of what's going on. But will he discover the truth? Max also pays a visit to Ian after hearing he has pulled out of the sale of the chip shop. Robbie nervously awaits a visit from his boss, while Kush encourages Shakil to invite Bex to the prom.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Essie worries that she is not being a good foster parent to Parker, but determined to take all the responsibility herself, she is reluctant to accept any help from Raf. Meanwhile, a tricky patient diagnosis throws Morven straight in at the deep end on her first day back, and Matteo recruits an unenthusiastic Jac to work with Damon on his assessment day.(n)

programme.title: In the Dark
programme.desc: Helen and Paul are joined by pathologist friend Phil Hendricks as they become further embroiled in the abduction case. The clock is ticking to find Poppy alive and clear Bates's name, but to Paul's vexation, Helen seems increasingly disturbed by being in Polesford. Is she too distracted by pressing secrets past and present to keep her mind on the case? Crime drama, starring MyAnna Buring and Ben Batt.(n)

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: In a special edition of the detective drama that features only two members of the team, Gerry Standing and Steve McAndrew travel to Glasgow, where a new Ucos section is being set up. While there, they agree to assist the investigation into the 1993 unsolved murder of James Soutar, the wealthy owner of a string of betting shops. Cathy Sinclair, one of the beneficiaries of the bookie's will at his death, had a care-home upbringing in common with Soutar, but she claims to have no idea who he was or why she was left £15,000. McAndrew has a personal stake in the case - the original investigating officer was corrupt cop Frank McNair, who had an affair with his wife, and their paths soon cross. The London-based officers' questions begin to unsettle someone and a campaign of victimisation against them begins, but it's a revelation from McAndrew's girlfriend Charley that reawakens a long-dormant scandal and clears the path to a solution. Dennis Waterman and Denis Lawson star.(n)

programme.title: True North
programme.desc: The Donnelly family from rural County Armagh are thought to be the oldest group of siblings in the world. Collectively their ages add up to 1,064 years. Angela Scanlon meets them as they attempt to get a world record. Part of BBC One's Our Lives strand.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Right on the Money
programme.desc: Denise Lewis and Dominic Littlewood help two sisters seeking to transform their passion for food into a successful business, and an expert urges them to embrace social media.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore properties in Crewe, Cheshire, Gillingham in Kent and Addlestone in Surrey, including two semi-detached houses and a bungalow. They then speak to the buyers about their renovation plans and return later to see the final results.(n)

programme.title: Neighbourhood Blues
programme.desc: Immigration Enforcement investigates restaurants suspected of using illegal workers in Bath, while officers in Weston-super-Mare search for those involved in a spate of stabbings.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford, Angela Rippon and Julia Somerville investigate viewers' holidays impacted by unexpected disasters, and questions if holiday companies do enough to keep them safe.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: In Lincoln, antiques experts Raj Basram and Kate Bliss assist two teams comprising twin sisters and twin brothers competing to buy three items in the hope of making the most profit at auction. Paul Laidlaw keeps his eye on proceedings and also boldly goes where no Bargain Hunt presenter has gone before.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Sharon suspects Paudge's guilty secret, David feels excluded by Katie's actions, and teen Rachel is frustrated that Conor seems to prefer heroin to her.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple with a £500,000 budget search for a home in the Oxfordshire countryside. Away from the hunt, Jules visits a 17th-century Jacobean house.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore salvages a chest of drawers, a kitchen worktop and three chairs from being discarded in Stockport, and attempts to make a profit through renovating them.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team visit Hopetoun House not far from Edinburgh. Antiques experts James Lewis and Adam Partridge are on hand to value items, while Paul discovers the architectural history of Hopetoun House and why it is such a unique treasure in the Scottish countryside.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Former England bowler Graeme Swann answers questions on the original Star Wars trilogy, Gogglebox's the Rev Kate Bottley on Adrian Mole, DJ Janice Long on Echo & The Bunnymen, and the musician Paul Carrack answers questions on Sheffield Wednesday. Host John Humphrys also puts the celebrities through a general knowledge round.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: Officers search for a Polish man convicted of a series of increasingly violent robberies, and Manchester-born con-artist is found after fleeing to Spain. Meanwhile in the West Midlands, Sergeant Ian Hands is searching for a wanted man, convicted of seven fraud offences in Poland back in 2005.(n)

programme.title: Watchdog
programme.desc: Stories include the phone giant whose mistakes have led to disastrous consequences far beyond what some might expect. Plus, Matt Allwright, Steph McGovern and Nikki Fox uncover shocking practices of another Rogue Trader, and guest reporter Brian Blessed uncovers secrets about some everyday appliances.(n)

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: The island is rocked when Saint Marie's governor Caroline Bamber drops dead at her leaving party, with the commissioner standing right next to her. As DI Goodman and the team try to deduce how she could have been poisoned without their boss noticing any foul play, they find themselves entering the murky world of island politics, where blackmail, threats and corruption seem commonplace - fuelled by ongoing tension between the French and British. Meanwhile, Humphrey braves the world of online dating, under the guidance of ladies' man Dwayne - and soon finds his perfect match. Lucy Cohu and Nigel Lindsay guest star.(n)

programme.title: Room 101 - Extra Storage
programme.desc: Extended edition of the comedy panel show presented by Frank Skinner, with Nicola Adams, Frankie Boyle and Diane Morgan competing to have their pet hates consigned to Room 101, with topics including magicians, losing your keys and life itself. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Natives: This is Our America
programme.desc: This documentary offers a unique insight into the life of a young Native American, and follows the protest against the Dakota Access oil pipeline which threatens their land.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Swimmer Rebecca Adlington joins comedy entertainer Brian Conley for a nostalgic look at the archive television programmes that helped set her on the path to Olympic success. Her selections include Fawlty Towers, Blind Date and Art Attack.(n)

programme.title: Right on the Money
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood and Denise Lewis help an 81-year-old woman struggling to juggle the family finances while caring for her husband, who is suffering from dementia.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents from Newark, with experts Charles Hanson and Philip Serrell, while Charlie pops into town and pays a visit to the Civil War centre.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: The team helps a couple whose 24-year-old son Ryan has been living in hospital for the last five years, as they renovate the downstairs of their three-bedroom house in Bristol so he can move back home. The house needs a downstairs extension with all the bespoke care provision that Ryan will need, including physio space, a wet-room, a family area and the ability to access the entire ground floor, and if the family doesn't get this work done, Ryan will remain in hospital 50 miles away.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold introduces action from the latest top-flight matches, including Wigan Warriors v Warrington Wolves, Leeds Rhinos v Hull FC and Castleford Tigers v Salford Red Devils.(n)

programme.title: Chronicles of a Champion Golfer
programme.sub-title: Tiger Woods, Tom Watson and Jack Nicklaus.
programme.desc: A look at how Tiger Woods, Tom Watson and Jack Nicklaus have fared at The Open, featuring first-person accounts from the trio, as they recount their famous victories.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Miracle Babies
programme.desc: Martin Hughes-Games explores the ground-breaking work being done by breeding programmes protecting some of the most threatened animals. He begins in China with the giant panda - which is being helped to become pregnant using medical techniques developed for humans. Martin also visits programmes in Jersey and Whipsnade Zoo aiming to protect the futures of the pied tamarin monkey, at risk from deforestation in Brazil, and the one-horned rhino.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of Our Living Planet
programme.desc: Chris Packham reveals the ways in which animals help balance the ecosystem and contribute towards the survival of the world's plains. He investigates how white rhinos in Kenya create essential nitrogen hotspots by trimming and fertilising grass, how fruit-eating maned wolves control the Brazilian Cerrado, discovers the Australian Outback is managed by rat kangaroos and bandicoots, and learns that termites are a worldwide source of protein.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Experts Charles Hanson and Christina Trevanion begin the second leg of their trip in Manchester, hoping to find bargains that will make a profit at auction, before making their way to Birkenhead, on the Wirral. Narrated by Tim Wonnacott.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Mel Giedroyc, as pairs of contestants go head-to-head to crack a series of passwords, in an attempt to take home £2,500 in cash.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Big Continental Road Trip
programme.desc: Paul spends six days exploring Germany in six different cars. After getting used to German driving on the streets of Berlin, he visits a Cold War checkpoint and a nudist colony, and pits cars made in the 1970s on either side of the Berlin Wall against each other. The trip ends at the Nurburgring racetrack, where he is joined by comedian Al Murray.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: New series. Gregg Wallace, Cherry Healey and Ruth Goodman investigate the origins and production of more household staples, beginning with tea. Gregg looks at the factory that produces one quarter of all the tea drunk in Britain. Meanwhile, Cherry Healey examines an African tea processing plant, and Ruth Goodman sheds light on how Second World War troops risked their lives to brew up.(n)

programme.title: Addicted Parents: Last Chance to Keep My Children
programme.desc: Part one of a two-part documentary following a year in a rehab centre for parents struggling with addictions, who are given six months to prove they can stay clean and look after their children. The first episode follows four mothers as they go through a detox treatment and reflect on the factors that have led to their addiction and the impact it has had on their children.(n)

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Russell and Hugh embark on their mission to recover the mayor's chain of office from the car park in Barnfather Woods. Sophie proves she's still very bad at spying, while Becky and Lance each have something important to tell Andy. Comedy, starring Mackenzie Crook, Toby Jones, Aimee-Ffion Edwards and Rachael Stirling.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: 1066: A Year to Conquer England
programme.desc: Docudrama in which Dan Snow explores the political intrigues and family betrayals between Vikings, Anglo-Saxons and Normans that led to the Battle of Hastings. The first edition reveals how the death of Edward the Confessor without an heir triggered a bitter race to succeed him as king of England, with Earl Harold successfully taking the crown. However, William of Normandy believes the throne has been promised to him and decides to invade, while Viking king Harald Hardrada also fancies himself as monarch.(n)

programme.title: The Life Swap Adventure
programme.desc: A Norwegian sheep farmer is finding the long hours and hard work of his demanding life are taking their toll. He trades places with a taxi driver from Devon who has dreams of running a farm, but fears the financial instability of giving up his job to pursue this goal. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Me and My Dog: The Ultimate Contest
programme.desc: Chris Packham hosts the show where dog owners and their pets compete in a series of unique challenges to test the levels of trust between man and dog. This time, the Red team have the first chance to score points in a paddle-boarding challenge in Lake Windermere, while the Yellow team take on a series of canine woodland obstacle courses. Finally, the teams take part in a challenging cross-country race, where the owners and their pets are tethered together, hoping to triumph in the second stage of the contest.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Comedian, actor and Cold Feet star John Thomson tells Brian Conley about the early TV programmes and adverts that shaped his life, from his love of Batman to his hatred of Bungle.(n)

programme.title: Right on the Money
programme.desc: Denise Lewis and Dominic Littlewood give advice on how to save money on holidays and days out, while the team helps a teacher trying to build a better life for her young twins.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin takes the bargain hunting teams to Leominster, Herefordshire, where two teams compete to buy three items that will hopefully make the greater profit at auction. Providing a helping hand to the sides are experts Paul Laidlaw and Mark Ashley. Plus, Natasha meets Royal Worcester aficionado Henry Sandon.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The South West heats continue with the fish course, and Tom Brown, Head Chef at Outlaw's at The Capital in Knightsbridge, is hoping he'll be able to elevate the humble mackerel to the standards required for the Wimbledon banquet. Meanwhile, his competitors, Andy Clatworthy and Dominic Chapman, are looking to score highly with their more luxurious dishes.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: South West chefs Dominic Chapman, Tom Brown and Andy Clatworthy go all out to impress with their main courses, as they compete for a chance to cook at the Taste of Summer banquet. With a refined summer barbecue going up against a traditional Cornish speciality and a historic Wimbledon-related recipe, who will come out on top?.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Including coverage of Prime Minister's Questions from the House of Commons at 12.00. Presented by Andrew Neil and Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: A Taste of Britain
programme.desc: Janet Street-Porter and Brian Turner travel the country to explore local delicacies, dishes, and recipes dating back hundreds of years. They begin their journey in East Sussex - specifically, in the Cinque Port of Rye, where they find some top-class scallops, and visit Bodiam Castle via a steam railway. Later, Janet tries her hand at making the local speciality bread, and Brian prepares a lamb dish.(n)

programme.title: Chronicles of a Champion Golfer
programme.sub-title: Darren Clarke, Nick Faldo and Rory McIlroy.
programme.desc: A look at how Darren Clarke, Nick Faldo and Rory McIlroy have fared at The Open, featuring contributions from all three golfers.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Miracle Babies
programme.desc: Zoologist Martin Hughes-Games explores captive breeding programmes, the only hope for some species. In the frozen forests on the border between North Korea and Russia, he hears about the plight of the Amur leopard, of which there are fewer than 40 surviving in the wild. Zoos around the world are trying to breed the big cat in a bid to one day return it to its home territory. He also visits an elephant orphanage in Nairobi, and discovers the fate of a rare Barbary lion - now nearly extinct - whose first breath could also have been its last at Belfast Zoo.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of Our Living Planet
programme.desc: Chris Packham investigates the ecosystem of North America's temperate forests, examining how it rebuilds itself in spring after harsh winters. He also reveals how the prey of the Canada lynx is dependent on a caterpillar that lives high up in the canopy, and discovers why the large trees of the north-west of the continent are reliant on bears and salmon.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Charles Hanson and Christina Trevanion begin their day shopping in Liverpool, before heading to Wigan and Preston. They end up at an auction in Lytham St Annes, Lancashire, where they find out whose haul proves most popular with buyers.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Mel Giedroyc, as pairs of contestants go head-to-head to crack a series of passwords, in an attempt to take home £2,500 in cash. As the teams solve the passwords, they win letters that will help them later in the game, giving them a better chance of cracking the final password which unlocks the Letterbox holding the cash prize. However, if they end up as the losing pair along the way, they'll have to surrender all the letters they've won to the winning pair - who will then go through to the semi-final eliminator round.(n)

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Big Continental Road Trip
programme.desc: The Bake Off judge concludes his trip in France, as he tries to find out what makes the country tick when it comes to cars. Paul's six-day road trip begins in Paris, where he is joined for the day by the host of French Top Gear, Philippe Lellouche. In a classic Citroen DS, they set off through the rain and experience the joys of Parisian traffic jams and the mayhem which is the roundabout around the Arc de Triomphe. The final day sees Paul travel to Magny-Cours racing circuit to meet two Formula 1 legends and Jean Pierre Jabouille, the man who drove the first F1 turbo car.(n)

programme.title: The Sweet Makers
programme.sub-title: The Sweet Makers: A Tudor Treat.
programme.desc: Four modern confectioners relive the world of historical sweets, making treats that have not been tasted in centuries from original recipes. The first episode focuses on the Tudor era, where the team makes candied roses and roots, sugar plates and goblets and a model banqueting house, while historians Annie Gray and Emma Dabiri reveal how sweets were a sign of wealth, but were made possible through the slave trade.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don visits a floral paradise outside of Dublin and discovers how Jimi Blake fills his garden with flora for free. Elsewhere, Nicky Bailey demonstrates how to transform a bland patio into a space that looks incredible at twilight, and Mark Lane travels to Oldham to visit the newly opened Maggie's Centre.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Adam Hills, host of Channel 4's The Last Leg, is the latest master of ceremonies at London's Hammersmith Apollo. He introduces US comic Michelle Wolf and sharp-witted Jamali Maddix to the stage.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: 1066: A Year to Conquer England
programme.desc: As Dan Snow's docudrama continues, King Harold has to take on two invasion forces. First, his brother Tostig attacks the south coast. He is repelled, but there is more to come. Later in the year, a vast Viking invasion force led by King Harald Hardrada of Norway lands in the north of England. Harold rushes to Stamford Bridge to fight for his kingdom and for his life.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Handmade: By Royal Appointment
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of the craftspeople behind the making, maintenance and restoration of Steinway pianos, from the German factory workers bending the frames and polishing the veneers to longstanding British restorer Jeff about to retire from the company. Steinway supplies pianos to the royal household as well as many leading performers, and the film goes behind the scenes as renowned pianist Lang Lang prepares for a concert at the Royal Albert Hall. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 10 Things You Didn't Know About
programme.sub-title: 10 Things You Didn't Know About Earthquakes.
programme.desc: Iain Stewart investigates some of the world's most destructive and devastating seismic activity, examining what makes earthquakes so difficult to predict or prevent. He also reveals why these powerful forces of nature can last up to 60 times longer on the surface of the moon than on Earth.(n)

programme.title: A Timewatch Guide
programme.sub-title: The Vikings: Foe or Friend? A Timewatch Guide.
programme.desc: In the year 793, Europe changed for ever when the famous monastery at Lindisfarne on the Northumbrian coast was suddenly attacked and looted by seafaring Scandinavians. Alice Roberts examines how the story of the Vikings has been portrayed on TV since the 1960s. She investigates how the focus has shifted from viewing them as brutal barbarians to pioneering traders, able to integrate into multiple cultures. She also considers how their huge trading empire spread and their surprising legacy in the modern world.(n)

programme.title: Secret Knowledge
programme.sub-title: Secret Knowledge: The Art of the Vikings.
programme.desc: Janina Ramirez explores the long-lasting effects of Viking culture on the British Isles through interpretations of a selection of archaeological items from the Swedish National Museum, which are now on display in Edinburgh.(n)

programme.title: Treasures of the Anglo-Saxons
programme.desc: Historian Dr Janina Ramirez investigates the development of Anglo-Saxon art. Examining the Sutton Hoo treasures the Franks Casket, the Staffordshire Hoard and the Lindisfarne Gospels, she uncovers the secret codes and symbols that reveal the pagan past and Christian future of the Anglo-Saxon people, and discusses how their artistic development was brought to an end by the Norman invasion of 1066.(n)

programme.title: World War Two: 1942 and Hitler's Soft Underbelly
programme.desc: David Reynolds explores the reasoning behind the Second World War battles that took place in North Africa and Italy - an area labelled Hitler's `soft underbelly' by Winston Churchill. Through his investigation, Reynolds discovers a prime minister who was politically vulnerable at home, desperate to shore up a crumbling British empire abroad and even ready to deceive his American allies. The programme marks the 70th anniversary of the Battle of El Alamein in 1942.(n)

programme.title: Medieval Lives: Birth, Marriage, Death
programme.desc: Historian Helen Castor explores how mortality was perceived in the Middle Ages, revealing that people looked upon death as a beginning rather than an ending - a doorway to everlasting life. The prospect of reaching Heaven and being remembered in a good light shaped not only people's behaviour, but also the buildings and funding of the Church itself. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Brits Who Built the Modern World
programme.desc: Documenting how from the late 1990s to the present day, British architects were at the peak of their success as they continued to design iconic structures. However, they also faced some of the biggest controversies of their careers as Richard Rogers reveals the problems he faced with the Millennium Dome, and Norman Foster recalls the troubles that could have jeopardised the creation of London's Millennium Bridge. Michael Hopkins also explains how parliamentary building Portcullis House became the most expensive office in the UK. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: A Timewatch Guide
programme.sub-title: The Vikings: Foe or Friend? A Timewatch Guide.
programme.desc: In the year 793, Europe changed for ever when the famous monastery at Lindisfarne on the Northumbrian coast was suddenly attacked and looted by seafaring Scandinavians. Alice Roberts examines how the story of the Vikings has been portrayed on TV since the 1960s. She investigates how the focus has shifted from viewing them as brutal barbarians to pioneering traders, able to integrate into multiple cultures. She also considers how their huge trading empire spread and their surprising legacy in the modern world.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Tank Men
programme.desc: Marking the 100th anniversary of the first time tanks were used in battle, Rob Bell tells the story of the First World War tank men and the impact they had on the conflict.(n)

programme.title: Jumbo: The Plane That Changed the World
programme.desc: Documentary examining the origins and development of the Boeing 747, which was the world's first wide-bodied commercial airliner and revolutionised air travel after coming into service in 1970. In interviews filmed on the original prototype, chief engineer Joe Sutter and his team describe the challenges they faced, from exploding engines to vibrations that threatened to tear the aircraft apart, and test pilot Brien Wygle reveals how on the first flight they hooked up car batteries as back-ups in case of engine failure.(n)

programme.title: Pedalling Dreams: The Raleigh Story
programme.desc: Documentary telling the tale of the ups and downs of Raleigh bikes, using personal testimony and rare and previously unseen archive film. Born in the back streets of Nottingham in 1888, Raleigh grew to become the biggest bicycle manufacturer in the world and, for more than a century, was known for its simple and practical bikes.(n)

programme.title: Sound Waves: The Symphony of Physics
programme.desc: Part two of two. Helen Czerski explores the extraordinary messages carried by sound waves, and how they can help humans gain a better understanding of the world around them.(n)

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor presents a documentary examining excursion trains, which became popular from the 1840s onwards, with tourists taking day trips and holidays, and seeing parts of the country they had never seen before. Some trains were set up to satisfy the demand to witness public executions, whereas others transported people to horse racing and sporting events. Working-class northerners had access to the Lake District, however Lakeland resident William Wordsworth was initially unhappy about the new visitors.(n)

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor examines how the railways enabled people to live further and further from the places where they worked, visiting London and the south east of England, the nation's largest commuter zone.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with historian and broadcaster Suzannah Lipscomb in Dictionary Corner alongside Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Karen takes Jack out to celebrate his success at nursing school, only to bump into her arch-enemy. Grace is reunited with an old flame, and Will is stood up on a dinner date. Candice Bergen (Murphy Brown) guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will forgoes Grace's annual Christmas party to spend the night camping out for concert tickets - but his weak bladder forces him to ask his snubbed friend to hold his place. Festive episode of the comedy, guest starring singer Barry Manilow, with Eric McCormack.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra's snooty parents announce they are going to pay a visit - much to the dismay of Ray, who pleads with Frank and Marie to be on their best behaviour and avoid embarrassing him. Ray Romano stars.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray ignores Frank's advice and loses all his cash in a poker game. Debra urges him to ask for the money back, but he is too proud to beg his father for help. Comedy, starring Ray Romano.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles takes a sudden liking to fast food, Ronee alarms Martin by revealing her mother is coming to town, while Frasier pines for attractive matchmaker Charlotte, and heads for a singles bar to drown his sorrows. Comedy, guest starring Laura Linney and Jennifer Tilly, with Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Frank almost gets in the way of Frasier's latest meeting with Charlotte, but the pair finally admit their feelings. Roz goes on a date with a jailbird and Martin plans to present Ronee with an old engagement ring - until Daphne points out how insensitive it would be.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Charlotte accepts a lift to the railway station from Frasier, but his car breaks down in a desolate area and they end up spending the night in the same room as a dead body. Meanwhile, confusion arises as Niles plans Martin's stag party.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Bruce `Two Dogs' Bozsum, the chairman of a Native American gaming and entertainment empire, goes undercover among his own employees to learn how he might be able to improve his organisation and ensure it flourishes for generations to come. He poses as a reality TV contestant who is trying to win funds to start up his own business, before revealing his true identity and offering rewards to some of the memorable people he has met.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Each year Mary Anderson likes to avoid the UK's cold winter months by spending her time in Naples in Florida, and now wishes to secure her own property in the region. Sara Damergi helps her identify suitable premises, which include a house with its own pool and a beach apartment.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Boat-dwelling Steven kicks off the competition in East Anglia, accompanied by his partner of 10 years, Lisa, with a Sunday lunch-inspired roast dinner with a fresh fish starter. Day two sees self-confessed snob Justine and partner Ben bring some class to the competition with an Italian themed evening. Finally it's the turn of Rosa and Darren who outsource all their ingredients from Spain.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Sheffield pawnbroker Dan values a handbag believed to once belong to Cheryl, and finds a pair of designer Tom Ford shoes that could be worth a small fortune.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley host as contestants pit their wits against vowels, consonants and numbers. Chris Packham is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: The Question Jury
programme.desc: The quiz continues as seven strangers try to answer questions unanimously. Today, two of the contestants fail to see eye to eye as the conversation turns personal.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jane and Jilly from Brighton look for a holiday home in the Dordogne region of south-west France. Laura Hamilton shows them five suitable properties for their £100,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Amanda Lucia-Charley and her friend Alan Talbot invite the other hoteliers to sample the delights of Crystals on The Prom in Blackpool, where Alan introduces his alter-ego, Ada.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Sheffield, retired teacher Deborah gives a masterclass in how to host a dinner party, but it remains to be seen whether bad boy Paul needs a lesson in manners.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: You Kent Always Say What You Want.
programme.desc: Homer accidentally causes the sacking of newsreader Kent Brockman - who moves in with the family and sets about trying to win his job back by conducting a high-profile campaign against unethical media practices. With the voice of rapper Ludacris.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Cindy is alone at the hotel in Liverpool with DS Armstrong, and Simone gets emotional when babysitting Daniel. Elsewhere, Scott opens up about his past, and Marnie is in for a treat.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.sub-title: World Para Athletics Championships London 2017: Day Five.
programme.desc: Lee McKenzie, Ade Adepitan and Arthur Williams present coverage of the evening session on day five of the Championships, which takes place at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, and is scheduled to include the finals of the women's F20 shot put and T47 100m, as well as the men's T13 and T54 200m. With expert analysis from Jonnie Peacock, Stef Reid, Danny Crates and Natasha Baker, and commentary by John Rawling, Rob Walker and Katharine Merry.(n)

programme.title: When Football Banned Women
programme.desc: Clare Balding uncovers the hidden history of women's football. A hundred years ago, the women's game dominated the headlines and attracted crowds of up to 60,000. The star players everyone wanted to see were teenage striker Lily Parr and her teammate Alice Woods, and the most popular team in England was Dick, Kerr's Ladies. Clare reveals how women's football teams grew out of munitions factories during the First World War where women had replaced men sent into battle. It also uncovers an untold chapter in the fight for equality waged at a time when women ruled the pitch.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 36-year-old man is rushed to St George's after being involved in a high-speed road traffic collision, with CT scans revealing a potentially life-threatening injury to his spleen. Meanwhile, a 21-year-old who dislocated his finger scoring the winning points in a basketball match believes his trip to A&E is the perfect subject for one of his vlogs.(n)

programme.title: Sound and Vision
programme.desc: Billie JD Porter looks at the phenomenon of grime music, and with the help of MOBO award winner Lady Leshurr, explores why we are seeing a lack of female acts breaking through.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to New Jersey's Spanish Pavilion, which is run by two warring brothers whose staff spend more time using their mobile phones than working. The chef plans to turn the eatery's fortunes around, and starts by giving the dining room and menu a modern makeover.(n)

programme.title: Real, Fake or Unknown
programme.desc: Proving the authenticity of internet promotional videos, featuring a European video advertising a new extreme sport and a commercial for a jet-powered hoverboard.(n)

programme.title: Wall Street: Money Never Sleeps
programme.desc: Ruthless stockbroker Gordon Gekko is released from prison after eight years, reinventing himself as an author and lecturer warning against the dangers of the financial system. Gekko helps a young banker get revenge on the company that drove his mentor to suicide, but as always, has a crooked agenda of his own. Oliver Stone's sequel to his 1980s drama, with Michael Douglas, Shia LaBeouf and Carey Mulligan.(n)

programme.title: Shipping Wars UK
programme.desc: Dave and Jenny set off on their first trip abroad together, moving a fragile Russian art collection from Canary Wharf, London to an international art fair in Amsterdam.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp is taught how to bind books by expert Isabelle Ting, and reveals how to create a notebook from leftover materials including leather offcuts, recycled leather coats and decorative paper.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer heads to the Tyne Valley, near Newcastle, to help Kerry Ellis and Michael Byrne, who have a budget of £150,000 to spend on their first property, but are finding house-hunting difficult as Kerry works in Manchester. Also in the area, Kirstie Allsopp searches for a rural home with a garden suitable for David and Kate Whitehead, who are expecting their second child.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley host as contestants pit their wits against vowels, consonants and numbers. Chris Packham is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace

programme.title: UEFA Euro 2017 Live
programme.sub-title: UEFA Women's Euro 2017: England v Scotland.
programme.desc: England v Scotland (Kick-off 7.45pm). Coverage of the opening match in Group D for both sides, which takes place at Stadion Galgenwaard in Utrecht, Netherlands. Having finished third at the most recent World Cup, England will be among the favourites to win this tournament, but will be keen to perform better than they did at the 2013 Championships, when a record of one draw and two defeats saw them finish bottom of their group. Meanwhile, this is the first appearance at a major championships for Scotland, and it is somewhat apt that they make their debut against England given their first-ever international match in 1972 was against the same opposition. Presented by Clare Balding, with expert analysis from Michael Owen, Eniola Aluko and Kim Little.(n)

Chris Hodson and Jonathan Smith fell in love with the old building with their hearts rather their heads, and five months in the pair now realise the amount of work needed to bring the hotel into the 21st century. Alex arrives a night early to find a cluttered, dark decor with no one on reception and quickly realises she needs to help motivate Chris to change the way he manages his team. programme.title: Witches: A Century of Murder
programme.sub-title: Witch Hunt: A Century of Murder.
programme.desc: Suzannah Lipscomb investigates the origins of the obsession for mass witch hunts and trials that swept the British Isles during the 17th century. Travelling to Scotland and Denmark, she challenges the accepted wisdom that King James VI of Scotland, later James I of England, was responsible for stirring up the hysteria. She also tells the story of Scotland's first mass witch trial in 1590 and the infamous Pendle witch trials towards the end of his reign.(n)

He was regarded as the chief exponent of the Baroque style, merging the grace of the Italian High Renaissance with the realism and landscapes of the northern tradition, and was perhaps best known for painting voluptuous female nudes within large-scale mythological allegories.(n)

programme.title: The Highland Midwife
programme.desc: Pam Ferris narrates one final trip into the Scottish Highlands, as midwife Morven helps Carrie, a hairdresser in Tain who travels to work. Carrie did not feel labour contractions during her first pregnancy, and is now worried she may end up giving birth in her car. First-time mother-to-be Sian relies on care from Donna, as her existing medical problems cause her to fall in an `at-risk' category. Plus, Hazel faces the difficult decision of whether to move prospective mum Claire, who is determined to have her baby at home, to the safety of a hospital.(n)

programme.title: Sarah Payne: A Mother's Story
programme.desc: Documentary shedding light on the emotional fallout of the murder of Sarah Payne, the eight-year-old girl who was kidnapped and killed in Kingston Gorse, West Sussex in 2000. Two weeks after her disappearance, Sarah's body was found, and after a high-profile police investigation, Roy Whiting was convicted of her murder and sentenced to life imprisonment. Testimonies from friends, family, police officers, key witnesses and experts in criminology are combined with an interview with Sarah's mother, to illustrate the tragic toll the case took on those closest to the victim.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
