programme.desc: In this thrilling action flick set in Paris, a maverick CIA agent forges an unlikely bond with a pickpocket as they investigate a terrorist conspiracy targeting the city's Bastille Day celebrations(n)

programme.title: Pride and Glory
programme.desc: An NYPD detective's probe into the murder of four cops points to corruption and his own brother and brother-in-law---both of whom are cops. Edward Norton, Colin Farrell and Jon Voight star in this gritty and well-acted tale of duty, honor and loyalty. Noah Emmerich, Jennifer Ehle. Directed by Gavin O'Connor(n)

programme.title: The Mark of Zorro
programme.desc: The son of an aristocrat in 19th-century California dons a mask to help fight for the downtrodden people oppressed by a wicked governor. Complicating matters is the vigilante's affections for the governor's beautiful niece(n)

programme.title: In America
programme.desc: An aspiring Irish actor and his family illegally immigrate in the United States with the dreams of the father breaking into the New York City theatrical scene. Once they arrive in the big city, they move into a flop house and try to make it truly their home. While they struggle to fit in their new country, the family finds new friends like the reclusive neighbour, Mateo, who provide help in the most unexpected ways in America(n)

programme.title: Domestic Disturbance
programme.desc: A divorced boat builder discovers that his young son's stepdad is masking an evil side, forcing him to desperately try to protect his ex-wife and son from the new man in their lives(n)

programme.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still
programme.desc: Director Scott Derrickson's remake of the 1951 sci-fi classic replaces the original's theme of fear of impending nuclear war with current concerns for environmental catastrophe. Keanu Reeves stars as Klaatu, an alien sent by a confederation of extraterrestrial beings to warn the inhabitants of Earth that the biosphere is on the verge of collapse. Predictably, as soon as he emerges from his spaceship a trigger-happy soldier ignores his instructions and takes a shot at the visitor. The wounded Klaatu asks for access to the United Nations to deliver his message, but the Secretary of Defence, Regina Jackson, instead orders that he should be taken away for further investigations. Klaatu becomes increasingly convinced that Earth can only survive if mankind is eradicated..(n)

programme.title: The Sum of All Fears
programme.desc: CIA agent Jack Ryan races to avert war between Russia and the US after a terrorist threatens to detonate a nuclear bomb(n)

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: New York cop John McClane fights terrorists in an Los Angeles skyscraper in a bid to rescue his estranged wife, who happens to be one of the hostages(n)

programme.title: The Informant!
programme.desc: When Mark Whitacre discovers that his company is involved in price-fixing, he becomes an informant for the FBI. Convinced he'll be hailed as a hero for his efforts, he agrees to wear a wire and gathers evidence to convict his bosses. Unfortunately, both the case and Whitacre's integrity are compromised when the FBI agents discover that he isn't the saintly figure he made himself out to be(n)

programme.title: Keeping the Faith
programme.desc: Actor Edward Norton debuts as a director with this comedy-drama about love, friendship, and faith. Priest Brian Finn (Norton) and rabbi Jacob Schram (Ben Stiller) have known each other since childhood. When Anna Reilly (Jenna Elfman), whom they both knew as children, returns to New York, both men find themselves infatuated with her, sparking both rivalry and personal dilemmas: Brian has taken a vow of celibacy, and Jacob is allowed to marry only within his faith. Award-winning director Milos Forman appears in the supporting cast, alongside Anne Bancroft, Ron Rifkin, and Eli Wallach; the screenplay marks the debut of writer Stuart Blumberg, whom Norton met when they were both undergraduates at Yale(n)

programme.title: Forgetting Sarah Marshall
programme.desc: In this fizzy, funny take on the classic screwball comedy, Jason Segel ("How I Met Your Mother") stars as a lovelorn composer who flies to a Hawaiian resort in hopes of forgetting the woman who broke his heart (Kristen Bell, "Veronica Mars"). But when he arrives he realizes she and her new boyfriend have just checked in. Mila Kunis, Russell Brand, Bill Hader(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Ford Fairlane
programme.desc: Stand-up comic Andrew Dice Clay stars as Los Angeles private-eye Ford Fairlane in this outrageous comedy-adventure. A detective to the stars, Fairlane is called in to investigate the mysterious death of a heavy metal singer, soon finding himself embroiled in a dangerous plot of treachery, double-cross and murder(n)

programme.title: Carlito's Way
programme.desc: A Puerto-Rican ex-con, just released from prison, pledges to stay away from drugs and violence despite the pressure around him and lead on to a better life outside of NYC(n)

programme.title: MI-5
programme.desc: In this spy-thriller former MI-5 agent Will Holloway (Kit Harington) is forced to partner with Harry Pierce (Peter Firth), the MI5 Intelligence Chief who decommissioned him, to apprehend a terrorist Adem Qasim (Elyes Gabel) who escaped during routine prisoner transport. A disgraced Harry faked his death after the Qasim escaped and Will was brought back into the MI-5 fold to locate Harry and return him to headquarters. Harry convinces Will that there is a traitor in MI-5 and they must work together to prevent a terrorist attack on the city of London. The film is based on the British television series Spooks created by David Wolstencroft. Directed by Bharat Nalluri. Cast includes Lara Pulver, David Harewood and Jennifer Ehle(n)

programme.title: Snow White: A Tale of Terror
programme.desc: Dark adaptation of the classic Grimm fairy tale. Notable for its unsettling atmosphere and bleak Czech locations, this film offers a mature, faithful interpretation of the Snow White story(n)

His job is to remove all traces of the identity of any witness in the program and to, as called for, eliminate threats against any of those witnesses. When a high level executive with a U.S. weapons manufacturer, turns over evidence of illegal arms deals to the FBI, John is assigned to protect her(n)

programme.desc: Arthur and Norma Lewis receive a mysterious box that will grant them $1 million if they push the button inside, but they must debate if that's worth the consequence of killing a random person(n)

programme.title: Constantine
programme.desc: Chain-smoking loner Constantine tries to buy his place in Heaven by banishing Earth-bound demons back to Hell. But his fate is tied up with Angela, a cop investigating the alleged suicide of her twin(n)

programme.title: Deadpool
programme.desc: A bizarre experiment transforms a wise-cracking mercenary into a superpowered anti-hero(n)

programme.title: Eraser
programme.desc: John Kruger works for the witness relocation program as a U.S. Marshal. His job is to remove all traces of the identity of any witness in the program and to, as called for, eliminate threats against any of those witnesses. When a high level executive with a U.S. weapons manufacturer, turns over evidence of illegal arms deals to the FBI, John is assigned to protect her(n)

programme.title: Pale Rider
programme.desc: Atmospheric western about a gun-toting preacher who defends a settlement from attack. In the late 1800s, a young girl witnesses a violent attack on a gold-mining settlement and prays for a miracle to save the camp and its people. Her prayers seem answered when a stranger arrives and helps the prospectors defend themselves. But his real motives are a mystery(n)

programme.title: The Take
programme.desc: In this thrilling action flick set in Paris, a maverick CIA agent forges an unlikely bond with a pickpocket as they investigate a terrorist conspiracy targeting the city's Bastille Day celebrations(n)

programme.title: Pride and Glory
programme.desc: An NYPD detective's probe into the murder of four cops points to corruption and his own brother and brother-in-law---both of whom are cops. Edward Norton, Colin Farrell and Jon Voight star in this gritty and well-acted tale of duty, honor and loyalty. Noah Emmerich, Jennifer Ehle. Directed by Gavin O'Connor(n)

programme.title: The Mark of Zorro
programme.desc: The son of an aristocrat in 19th-century California dons a mask to help fight for the downtrodden people oppressed by a wicked governor. Complicating matters is the vigilante's affections for the governor's beautiful niece(n)

programme.title: In America
programme.desc: An aspiring Irish actor and his family illegally immigrate in the United States with the dreams of the father breaking into the New York City theatrical scene. Once they arrive in the big city, they move into a flop house and try to make it truly their home. While they struggle to fit in their new country, the family finds new friends like the reclusive neighbour, Mateo, who provide help in the most unexpected ways in America(n)

programme.title: Domestic Disturbance
programme.desc: A divorced boat builder discovers that his young son's stepdad is masking an evil side, forcing him to desperately try to protect his ex-wife and son from the new man in their lives(n)

programme.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still
programme.desc: Director Scott Derrickson's remake of the 1951 sci-fi classic replaces the original's theme of fear of impending nuclear war with current concerns for environmental catastrophe. Keanu Reeves stars as Klaatu, an alien sent by a confederation of extraterrestrial beings to warn the inhabitants of Earth that the biosphere is on the verge of collapse. Predictably, as soon as he emerges from his spaceship a trigger-happy soldier ignores his instructions and takes a shot at the visitor. The wounded Klaatu asks for access to the United Nations to deliver his message, but the Secretary of Defence, Regina Jackson, instead orders that he should be taken away for further investigations. Klaatu becomes increasingly convinced that Earth can only survive if mankind is eradicated..(n)

programme.title: The Sum of All Fears
programme.desc: CIA agent Jack Ryan races to avert war between Russia and the US after a terrorist threatens to detonate a nuclear bomb(n)

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: New York cop John McClane fights terrorists in an Los Angeles skyscraper in a bid to rescue his estranged wife, who happens to be one of the hostages(n)

programme.title: The Informant!
programme.desc: When Mark Whitacre discovers that his company is involved in price-fixing, he becomes an informant for the FBI. Convinced he'll be hailed as a hero for his efforts, he agrees to wear a wire and gathers evidence to convict his bosses. Unfortunately, both the case and Whitacre's integrity are compromised when the FBI agents discover that he isn't the saintly figure he made himself out to be(n)

programme.title: Keeping the Faith
programme.desc: Actor Edward Norton debuts as a director with this comedy-drama about love, friendship, and faith. Priest Brian Finn (Norton) and rabbi Jacob Schram (Ben Stiller) have known each other since childhood. When Anna Reilly (Jenna Elfman), whom they both knew as children, returns to New York, both men find themselves infatuated with her, sparking both rivalry and personal dilemmas: Brian has taken a vow of celibacy, and Jacob is allowed to marry only within his faith. Award-winning director Milos Forman appears in the supporting cast, alongside Anne Bancroft, Ron Rifkin, and Eli Wallach; the screenplay marks the debut of writer Stuart Blumberg, whom Norton met when they were both undergraduates at Yale(n)

programme.title: Forgetting Sarah Marshall
programme.desc: In this fizzy, funny take on the classic screwball comedy, Jason Segel ("How I Met Your Mother") stars as a lovelorn composer who flies to a Hawaiian resort in hopes of forgetting the woman who broke his heart (Kristen Bell, "Veronica Mars"). But when he arrives he realizes she and her new boyfriend have just checked in. Mila Kunis, Russell Brand, Bill Hader(n)

programme.title: The Adventures of Ford Fairlane
programme.desc: Stand-up comic Andrew Dice Clay stars as Los Angeles private-eye Ford Fairlane in this outrageous comedy-adventure. A detective to the stars, Fairlane is called in to investigate the mysterious death of a heavy metal singer, soon finding himself embroiled in a dangerous plot of treachery, double-cross and murder(n)

programme.title: Carlito's Way

programme.title: MI-5
programme.desc: In this spy-thriller former MI-5 agent Will Holloway (Kit Harington) is forced to partner with Harry Pierce (Peter Firth), the MI5 Intelligence Chief who decommissioned him, to apprehend a terrorist Adem Qasim (Elyes Gabel) who escaped during routine prisoner transport. A disgraced Harry faked his death after the Qasim escaped and Will was brought back into the MI-5 fold to locate Harry and return him to headquarters. Harry convinces Will that there is a traitor in MI-5 and they must work together to prevent a terrorist attack on the city of London. The film is based on the British television series Spooks created by David Wolstencroft. Directed by Bharat Nalluri. Cast includes Lara Pulver, David Harewood and Jennifer Ehle(n)

programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May immerse themselves in nostalgia and try to prove that hot hatches from their younger days are better than today's equivalents. programme.desc: Part one of two. The former footballer embarks on an Amazon adventure, mainly on motorbike, accompanied by three of his closest friends: photographer and video director Anthony Mandler, biker expert Derek White, and Dave Gardner, his manager and boyhood buddy. Before flying to Manaus, the starting point of the journey through the rainforest, Beckham enjoys a game of beach foot-volleyball with locals from Rio's Vidigal favela, but things look set to hot up when almost 800 miles of boat and bike travel brings them to a remote jungle territory, home of the Yanonami tribe.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Mekong River with Sue Perkins
programme.desc: The comedienne and Great British Bake Off presenter embarks on a 3,000-mile journey along the Southeast Asian river, exploring lives and landscapes on the point of dramatic change. She begins in Vietnam, where she meets traditional river people caught up in a new capitalist revolution, before trying her hand as a noodle saleswoman and prawn farmer. Continuing to Cambodia, she is moved by the tale of a survivor of Pol Pot's genocide, before bonding with the residents of a floating village whose survival depends on the bounty of Tonle Sap, the largest freshwater lake in Asia.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of Bones
programme.desc: Evolutionary biologist Ben Garrod explores how having a skeleton has helped vertebrates to colonise and dominate almost every habitat on Earth. He begins his journey by looking at the influence of bones on size, revealing how they are capable of supporting large animals, with the strongest bone able to withstand 109 tons of pressure.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Fishing with Robson Green
programme.desc: During a visit to Thailand, the actor samples the delights of Bangkok's famed fish market before trying to land arapaima. He visits the River Kwai to learn traditional fishing techniques, spends a night on a raft in the middle of a lake, and rounds off his trip with a hunt for stingray.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines how the arrival of winter sparks a ruthless battle for survival in the polar regions, with temperatures plummeting to -70C, winds reaching 120mph and day-long darkness. As a blizzard rages, a polar bear treks into the Arctic mountains to give birth, while the entire world population of spectacled eider braves the weather in a giant ice hole. Wolves and bison engage in battle, but alliances are also made, and beneath the snow, voles try to dodge the attacks of great grey owls and weasels.(n)

programme.title: The Mekong River with Sue Perkins
programme.desc: The comedienne and Great British Bake Off presenter embarks on a 3,000-mile journey along the Southeast Asian river, exploring lives and landscapes on the point of dramatic change. She begins in Vietnam, where she meets traditional river people caught up in a new capitalist revolution, before trying her hand as a noodle saleswoman and prawn farmer. Continuing to Cambodia, she is moved by the tale of a survivor of Pol Pot's genocide, before bonding with the residents of a floating village whose survival depends on the bounty of Tonle Sap, the largest freshwater lake in Asia.(n)

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: The effect of the rainy season on wildlife in Asia, with floods forcing animals to flee from Kaziranga National Park in north-east India in search of the safety of the hills. In Cambodia, the Mekong river swells so much that water is forced back up one of its tributaries to fill the vast Tonle Sap lake - one of the most productive freshwater fisheries on Earth. Fresh grass draws nomads and their vast herds of livestock back to their homelands, but they are stalked by hungry wolves and hyenas, which move in at night for the kill. Colin Salmon narrates.(n)

programme.title: Wild Ones

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: The Mekong River with Sue Perkins
programme.desc: The comedienne embarks on the most emotional leg of her journey along the Southeast Asian river as she witnesses how deforestation and wildlife crime are stripping Cambodia of its last wild places. She goes on a raid with a rapid response rescue team searching for trafficked animals and bush meat, as well as helping the unit release macaques and a slow loris back into the wild. She also spends time with the women of the Krung, who live in the remote highlands of Ratanakiri and are one of the tribes most affected by rapid deforestation.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of Bones
programme.desc: Evolutionary biologist Ben Garrod explores how skeletons have adapted to allow vertebrates to move on land in different ways, such as swinging through trees, sliding along forest floors, and running across plains at speed. He looks at the spines of both cheetahs and snakes, and uncovers the role of the pentadactyl limb.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Fishing with Robson Green
programme.desc: The actor travels to the Philippines, where fishing plays an important part in the economy and people's diets. He begins by hunting green and blue dorado, before catching and eating a jellyfish. He also visits Casulian Island to learn about the illegal practice of dynamite fishing and meets two men convicted of the crime. Finally, Robson is left to fend for himself overnight on a tropical island.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the life and work of people in the polar regions, including the residents of Norilsk in Siberia, the coldest city on Earth. He also discovers how the Danish armed forces maintain their country's claim to Greenland's natural resources by mounting a 2,000-mile dog sled patrol during the winter, and finds out how a research base at the South Pole is able to cope with being cut off from the outside world for six months at a time.(n)

programme.title: The Mekong River with Sue Perkins
programme.desc: The comedienne embarks on the most emotional leg of her journey along the Southeast Asian river as she witnesses how deforestation and wildlife crime are stripping Cambodia of its last wild places. She goes on a raid with a rapid response rescue team searching for trafficked animals and bush meat, as well as helping the unit release macaques and a slow loris back into the wild. She also spends time with the women of the Krung, who live in the remote highlands of Ratanakiri and are one of the tribes most affected by rapid deforestation.(n)

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: The other side of the monsoon, as the winds bring dry air and drought. Budgerigars swarm in the Australian desert, gathering at a precious waterhole, and although birds of prey try to ambush them, they are mesmerised by the array of bright colours on show. On the island of Borneo, a bearded pig hunts for seafood on the beach, while in the Rajasthan desert, nomads haggle over the price of camels, which can provide vital transport during this lean season. The mugger crocodiles of Sri Lanka stalk the animals taking a much-needed drink and a young leopard learning to hunt discovers there is no such thing as an easy meal. Colin Salmon narrates.(n)

Finally, Robson is left to fend for himself overnight on a tropical island.(n)

programme.desc: The actor travels to the Philippines, where fishing plays an important part in the economy and people's diets. He begins by hunting green and blue dorado, before catching and eating a jellyfish. He also visits Casulian Island to learn about the illegal practice of dynamite fishing and meets two men convicted of the crime. Finally, Robson is left to fend for himself overnight on a tropical island.(n)

programme.title: The Mekong River with Sue Perkins
programme.desc: The comedienne embarks on the most emotional leg of her journey along the Southeast Asian river as she witnesses how deforestation and wildlife crime are stripping Cambodia of its last wild places. She goes on a raid with a rapid response rescue team searching for trafficked animals and bush meat, as well as helping the unit release macaques and a slow loris back into the wild. She also spends time with the women of the Krung, who live in the remote highlands of Ratanakiri and are one of the tribes most affected by rapid deforestation.(n)

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: The other side of the monsoon, as the winds bring dry air and drought. Budgerigars swarm in the Australian desert, gathering at a precious waterhole, and although birds of prey try to ambush them, they are mesmerised by the array of bright colours on show. On the island of Borneo, a bearded pig hunts for seafood on the beach, while in the Rajasthan desert, nomads haggle over the price of camels, which can provide vital transport during this lean season. The mugger crocodiles of Sri Lanka stalk the animals taking a much-needed drink and a young leopard learning to hunt discovers there is no such thing as an easy meal. Colin Salmon narrates.(n)

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the life and work of people in the polar regions, including the residents of Norilsk in Siberia, the coldest city on Earth. He also discovers how the Danish armed forces maintain their country's claim to Greenland's natural resources by mounting a 2,000-mile dog sled patrol during the winter, and finds out how a research base at the South Pole is able to cope with being cut off from the outside world for six months at a time.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of Bones
programme.desc: Evolutionary biologist Ben Garrod explores how skeletons have adapted to allow vertebrates to move on land in different ways, such as swinging through trees, sliding along forest floors, and running across plains at speed. He looks at the spines of both cheetahs and snakes, and uncovers the role of the pentadactyl limb.(n)

programme.title: Planet Oil
programme.sub-title: Planet Oil: The Treasure That Conquered the World.
programme.desc: Iain Stewart examines how the fuel has come to dominate the modern world, visiting the places that gave birth to the earth's oil riches, exploring the stories of the people who fought over its control and supply and looking at how mankind's insatiable thirst for oil is changing the planet. In the first episode he looks at how 19th-century amateur geologist George Bissell went searching for oily puddles in Pennsylvania that he had a hunch could be the source of a new kind of fuel, and follows the story on through the development of products that could light homes, and in turn provide power for the newly emerging mass car market.(n)

programme.title: The River Wild
programme.desc: Gail, an expert at white water rafting, takes her family on a trip down the river to their family's house. Along the way, the family encounters two men who are unexperienced rafters that need to find their friends down river. Later, the family finds out that the pair of men are armed robbers. The men then physically force the family to take them down the river to meet their accomplices. The rafting trip for the family is definitely ruined, but most importantly, their lives are at stake(n)

programme.title: The People vs. Larry Flynt
programme.desc: Intriguing portrait of porn publisher Larry Flynt, who won a First Amendment case before the U.S. Supreme Court(n)

programme.title: Jerry Maguire
programme.desc: When a sports agent has a moral epiphany and is fired for expressing it, he decides to put his new philosophy to the test as an independent with the only athlete who stays with him(n)

programme.title: Side Effects
programme.desc: Rooney Mara stars as Emily Taylor; her husband Martin (Channing Tatum) is a young businessman who, as the film opens, is soon to be released from prison after serving a few years for financial fraud. Overcome with stress, the mentally fragile Emily performs a quasi-suicide attempt and is put in the care of Dr. Jonathan Banks (Jude Law), a workaholic psychiatrist who convinces Emily to see him once a week for therapy. Jonathan is intrigued enough by Emily's story to seek counsel from her former therapist, Dr. Victoria Siebert (Catherine Zeta-Jones). One night Emily commits a horrific act that she claims not to remember because she was taking the medication prescribed to her by Jonathan, leading to a very public legal battle that leads to Jonathan taking a major public blow to his reputation. This turn of events prompts the chastened doctor to look deeper into Emily's past. Directed by Steven Soderbergh from a script by his regular collaborator Scott Z. Burns(n)

programme.title: Jarhead
programme.desc: US Marine Anthony Swofford may be a top sniper, but will he ever get to take the shot he's been trained for? War drama(n)

programme.title: Black Sheep
programme.desc: Political comedy in which a prospective state governor's election prospects are jeopardised by his wayward younger brother. Expecting his mischievous sibling to be something of a liability during his campaign, the aspiring politician orders one of his aides to keep him out of the public eye - a task he does not relish(n)

programme.title: Jerry Maguire
programme.desc: When a sports agent has a moral epiphany and is fired for expressing it, he decides to put his new philosophy to the test as an independent with the only athlete who stays with him(n)

programme.title: Dodgeball: A True Underdog Story
programme.desc: A group of oddballs enter a dodgeball tournament in order to raise money and save their precious local gym(n)

programme.title: Walk the Line
programme.desc: Joaquin Phoenix and Reese Witherspoon give award-winning performances and do their own singing in this touching portrait of music legend Johnny Cash and his tumultuous love affair with June Carter. Ginnifer Goodwin, Robert Patrick, Dallas Roberts. Directed by James Mangold(n)

programme.desc: Political comedy in which a prospective state governor's election prospects are jeopardised by his wayward younger brother. Expecting his mischievous sibling to be something of a liability during his campaign, the aspiring politician orders one of his aides to keep him out of the public eye - a task he does not relish(n)

programme.title: Starship Troopers
programme.desc: In the distant future, high school graduate Johnny Rico joins the military to impress his childhood sweetheart but is soon shipped out to the front lines of a vicious war between mankind and enormous alien bugs. Action(n)

programme.title: Commando
programme.desc: Action-adventure starring Arnold Schwarzenegger as a former special agent who reluctantly returns to duty when his daughter is kidnapped by a gang of right-wing extremists(n)

programme.title: Varsity Blues
programme.desc: In this rousing coming-of-age tale, a second-string high-school quarterback (James Van Der Beek) replaces the injured starter. At first, the quarterback revels in his new role, but then, his relaxed attitude causes problems with his gung-ho coach (Jon Voight). Paul Walker, Rob Lester, Scott Caan, Richard Lineback, Ali Larter, Tiffany C. Love(n)

programme.title: Days of Thunder
programme.desc: Tom Cruise plays Cole Trickle, a young hot-shot stock car racer determined to make it as top gun if he can find the right cocktail of car and manager, who comes along in the guise of racing legend Harry Hogge. As the pair tour the circuits, the climax builds up to Daytona and a showdown between Trickle and his arch-rival Russ Wheeler, who will stop at nothing to beat him. Tony Scott's all-action film captures the all-out excitement and speed of the sport, while Nicole Kidman as Dr Claire Lewicki provides the love interest(n)

programme.title: Quarantine
programme.desc: Jay Hernandez, Jennifer Carpenter, and Johnathon Schaech star in this remake of Jaume Balagueró and Paco Plaza's successful, Spanish-language horror film [REC], which follows a television reporter and her cameraman as they fall under a mysterious quarantine issued on an inner-city apartment building. Television reporter Angela Vidal (Carpenter) and her trusty cameraman (Steve Harris) were documenting a night in the life of a Los Angeles fire station crew when the firefighters were summoned to a nearby apartment building to answer a routine 911 call. Upon arriving at the scene, Angela and company discover that police have already arrived to investigate the blood-curdling screams ringing out from one of the apartments. One of the women living in the building has been infected with something terrible, but what? When a few of the other residents are viciously attacked, they try to escape and discover that the CDC has quarantined the building. The officials in charge won't relay any information to those trapped inside the building, and it's impossible to seek information from the outside since telephone, Internet, television, and cell-phone access have all been cut off. By the time the quarantine is lifted, the intrepid cameraman's chilling footage provides the only evidence of the horrors that unfolded on that terrible night(n)

programme.title: Out to Sea
programme.desc: Walter Matthau and Jack Lemmon freshen up their Grumpy Old Men routine and head out to sea to let what's left of their hair down in this light-hearted comedy. Matthau is Charlie, an inveterate gambler who takes his brother-in-law on a cruise to escape his debts and with hopes of meeting some rich old ladies. The catch is, to avoid paying for the trip, Charlie has signed them up as dance hosts, even though he does not know his waltz from his tango(n)

programme.title: Philadelphia
programme.desc: Hotshot lawyer Andrew Beckett takes his firm to court when he is sacked shortly after the partners discover he has AIDS(n)

programme.title: Commando
programme.desc: Action-adventure starring Arnold Schwarzenegger as a former special agent who reluctantly returns to duty when his daughter is kidnapped by a gang of right-wing extremists(n)

programme.desc: Ray Peterson's life revolves around his family and washing the car on a Sunday. But this all changes when the Klopeks move in next door. They're never seen and worse still is the noise which comes from the basement(n)

programme.title: What's Eating Gilbert Grape
programme.desc: In spite of these responsibilities, the young man attempts to lead a normal existence, until he meets a woman passing through town and life becomes even more complicated. Based on the novel by Peter Hedges(n)

programme.title: The Burbs

programme.title: The Night Before
programme.desc: Three best friends reunite every Christmas Eve for a wild night of debauchery in New York City. Since they're getting older and have new responsibilities, they plan one last epic bash together and try to find their way into the biggest party in the city, the Nutcracka Ball(n)

programme.title: Galaxy Quest
programme.desc: A team of intrepid adventurers travels through the outer reaches of the galaxy, each week finding excitement and adventure on Galaxy Quest! Or at least that's the way it was in the mid-1970s, when brave if reckless Captain Peter Quincy Taggart, lovely Lieutenant Tawny Madison, and inscrutable alien Dr. Lazarus were the leaders of an interstellar law enforcement team on the TV series of that name. Twenty years later, the show is still in reruns, and Jason Nesmith (Tim Allen), Gwen DeMarco (Sigourney Weaver), and Alexander Dane (Alan Rickman) prop up their sagging careers by making appearances at sci-fi conventions, where they grudgingly shake hands and give autographs for the show's socially inept following. However, it turns out that nerdy sci-fi fans aren't the only ones watching: somewhere in another solar system, a group of alien rebels living under a regime of violence and repression have picked up broadcasts of Galaxy Quest, and they aren't aware that it's fiction. They travel to Earth and encounter the Galaxy Quest cast, who figure that they're just another bunch of guys who like to dress funny. However, they soon realize that they're being hired not for another autograph-signing session but for a real-life outer space rescue mission. Galaxy Quest was directed by Dean Parisot, who had a background in TV directing before his theatrical debut with the dark comedy Home Fries(n)

programme.title: Game of Death
programme.desc: Story about a Hong Kong crime syndicate, with Bruce Lee footage from an unfinished 1973 film(n)

programme.title: Mindhunters
programme.desc: A serial killer lurks among the trainees in an elite FBI programme(n)

programme.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 1
programme.desc: Beatrix Kiddo aka "The Bride" was once part of a group of elite, top class female assassins, until the group leader, "Bill", and the other assassins turn against her and leave her for dead. Five years later "The Bride" wakes up from the coma the assassins left her in and begins her quest for vengeance. She works her way down the list of her ex-colleagues leaving her boss Bill for last. Hell hath no fury like a woman scorned…(n)

programme.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 2
programme.desc: The Bride has an epic showdown with her former boss and lover in the finale of Quentin Tarantino's stylised revenge saga(n)

programme.title: Hot Shots!
programme.desc: Fast-paced satire in which an ace pilot, drafted into an elite corps for 'Operation Weasel', must live down his father's battered reputation. He craves not only the respect of his colleagues, but also the love of Ramada Thompson - equestrian, sculptor, torch singer, and the base psychiatrist. The spoof aims many of its rapid-fire gags towards films of the 'Top Gun' and 'An Officer and a Gentleman' type(n)

programme.desc: Small-time private detective Marty Eels suddenly becomes a local celebrity by making a series of dazzling deductions to solve a crime, leaving Adrian feeling dejected at being upstaged - until he realises his new rival is a fraud. Guest starring Seinfeld's Jason Alexander.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.sub-title: So Long and Thanks for All the Red Snapper.
programme.desc: While investigating the murder of a surfer, Lisbon reconnects with her ex-fiance, whom she has not seen for more than a decade, and Cho questions whether he should be in a relationship with Summer. Crime drama, starring Robin Tunney, Tim Kang and Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane is consumed by memories of his wife and daughter as the eighth anniversary of their deaths arrives. To make matters worse, he is taunted by Red John, the serial killer he blames for their murders, and his lapse in concentration jeopardises Lisbon's latest case - as well as his position within the CBI. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane finds solace in the arms of a woman when his latest efforts to apprehend Red John fail. Lisbon and the team hunt for a murderer after an unidentifiable body is discovered. Crime drama, guest starring Emmanuelle Chriqui (Entourage), with Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Tensions rise between the CBI and the FBI as they try to cover up the events leading to Jane's unsuccessful takedown of Red John and the death of Wainwright. While Jane tries to find out more about Lorelei's connection to the serial killer, the agencies work together to investigate the murder of a hotel employee. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The wife of a crime boss is murdered in FBI custody. Brenda suspects the agent supposedly protecting her was corrupt and hastily tries to interrogate him before the FBI can regain control of the investigation. As the case unfolds, the team learns today's Mafia do not follow the traditional rules any more. Detective drama series, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Part one of two. Brenda takes involuntary leave, but ends up assisting an investigation into a murder linked to a terrorist group, while Commander Taylor takes advantage of her enforced layoff to try to break up the PHD. Crime drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Part two of two. Brenda discovers she has been given false information while attempting to find a terrorist-linked suspect. She is forced to untangle a web of deceit to determine who she can trust and prevent the PHD becoming the victims of a sinister plan.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: A teenager becomes the prime suspect in the murder of his family, and Brenda tries to resist the imposition of budget cuts at LAPD. Detective drama starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a Navy Lieutenant who has been murdered while on his way to a meeting with the President, and must ascertain whether the killing was part of a recent spate of muggings in the area - or a targeted hit to keep information secret. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Ducky works on a case involving his estranged childhood best friend, travelling to London with Special Agent Bishop to interview his pal's family and co-workers. While away, the detective reflects on his own past choices, and examines how they have affected his present life. Alice Krige guest stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The NCIS team is assigned to a joint terrorism task force by the Secretary when a Moscow-born scientist who it is believed may have been targeted by the Russians for selling state secrets, is found dead. The trail appears to lead to a friend of Sofia's, another scientist who worked for Russia and who may have succumbed to professional jealousy. However, when she too is found dead, the team discovers the hallmarks of Sergei Mishnev, the terrorist who nearly killed Gibbs. Starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: While on a joint Coast Guard and NCIS training exercise at sea with Agent Borin, Gibbs spots a dead man overboard, who is found to be a missing member of the crew of a nearby vessel. However, when the agent boards the ship for questioning, he realises it has been commandeered by pirates. Naval drama, starring Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: Marvel's Agent Carter
programme.desc: Former SAS officer Peggy Carter, who fought alongside Captain America during the Second World War, finds herself consigned to a desk job as hostilities come to an end. Frustrated by the red-tape that prevents her making use of her skills as an expert spy, Peggy jumps at the chance to get back out into the field when she is approached in secret by her old friend Howard Stark - father of future Iron Man Tony Stark - who has been labelled a traitor, and seeks her help to clear his name. Espionage drama, set during the late 1940s, starring Hayley Atwell.(n)

programme.title: Shots Fired
programme.desc: The district attorney assigns a new team to the case, but Preston remains determined to personally uncover the truth.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter and Lois are horrified to learn Meg is going out with a naturist. Meanwhile, Stewie enrols at the local drama school and shows promise - but his chances of success are compromised by rivalry with an ambitious fellow student.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter is mortified to find out Lois is meeting an old boyfriend and struggles to contain his jealousy. Meanwhile, Brian and Stewie are accidentally stuck together with strong industrial adhesive.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: The family discovers Stan has been secretly rebuilding a DeLorean car, so Francine suggests he take Steve with him on a road trip to find the final part, a door. However, they learn only one is available and they have little time to secure it.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Steve tries to make Stan proud of him by joining a junior football team, but ends up being dropped from the squad by his father. He enlists Roger's help to exact his revenge and recruits a team of misfits to spoil his dad's perfect season.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter discovers he has an African-American ancestor and his efforts to embrace his new-found heritage end with his demanding reparation from Lois's family. Meanwhile, Stewie tries to find out how cheerleaders control men's minds.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter tries to rebuild a dispirited Joe's self-confidence by helping him train for the decathlon at the Paralympics - a daunting task made easier by the occasional discreet dose of steroids. Meanwhile, Stewie, Chris and Meg argue over $26 they find at a charity car wash.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan forgets to buy grenadine at the grocery store, so an enraged Roger takes revenge by replacing him as chairman of the Homeowners' Association - and starts to abuse his own power. With the neighbourhood's American identity under threat, the spy enlists the help of his children to regain control of the community.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Steve asks Stan to join him in a father-son bike tournament, but discovers he has never learnt to ride a bicycle. Meanwhile, Roger hires Hayley to work in a makeshift bar that he has opened in the attic.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: A Very Special Family Guy Freakin' Christmas.
programme.desc: The Griffins somehow manage to celebrate Christmas, even though Lois's well-laid holiday plans fall apart, and Stewie convinces himself there really is a Santa Claus. With the guest voice of Kiss bassist Gene Simmons.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian is convicted of drink-driving and has to look after a cantankerous elderly woman as part of his community service. As their relationship develops, she reveals intriguing details of her past. Meanwhile, a swallow builds its nest in Peter's newly grown beard.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Steve loses his girlfriend to a boy who takes her to a bar mitzvah, and decides to sabotage the occasion out of revenge - but things do not go according to plan and Snot is wrongly accused of being a thief.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan is kidnapped during a CIA mission, and Francine worries he is never coming home. However, she is furious to discover he has a `back-up' wife on constant standby, and decides to make a similar pact with one of his fellow agents.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: As Halloween approaches, Monk is enlisted by his brother Ambrose, to solve the murder of an armoured car driver shot dead with his own gun. A vital clue is provided by the odd fact that a man dressed as Frankenstein's monster has begun stealing candy from trick-or-treating children. Guest starring John Turturro (Transformers).(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The CBI investigates the murder of a diamond cutter who was disembowelled with his own tools. After drinking a cup of tea at the victim's house, Jane finds a rabbit that was locked in a cabinet and chases the animal into a neighbour's yard. There, he meets a precocious young girl who claims to be his daughter Charlotte - the same one who was killed along with his wife by Red John. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A bank employee is murdered during a robbery and the CBI attempts to track down the killer. An analysis of surveillance footage from previous heists reveals a likely suspect, but without proof the CBI is forced to let him walk - although Jane surmises that the gang must have been working with an inside man. With the FBI breathing down their necks, the team helps Jane figure out who among the witnesses may have been involved in the crime.(n)

programme.title: Captain Phillips
programme.desc: Two-time Academy Award winner Tom Hanks teams with Oscar-nominated director Paul Greengrass and screenwriter Billy Ray to tell the true story of Richard Phillips, a U.S. cargo-ship captain who surrendered himself to Somali pirates so that his crew would be freed. Captain Richard Phillips (Hanks) and his crew are carrying freight around the Horn of Africa when four Somali pirates forcefully take over their ship, the MV Maersk Alabama. While Phillips' team follow his orders to hide until they hear him give the safe word, the captain and a few essential crew members remain on the bridge as the heavily armed pirates make their way up to seize control of the ship. But the interlopers soon discover something that sends them into a furious rage: After effectively shutting down the ship, Phillips explains that the Maersk had malfunctioned when the crew pushed it too hard in an attempt to evade the attackers. In order to appease their leader, the ruthless Muse (Barkhad Abdi), Phillips offers them the $30,000 that's been locked in the ship safe. But that isn't enough, and Muse demands that Phillips help him search every corner of the ship to root out the terrified crew. When that plan fails, the pirates agree to take the cash from the safe and flee in the Maersk's lifeboat. At the last minute, however, they kidnap Phillips in the hope of supplementing their take with a sizable ransom -- a decision that leads to a tense standoff with the U.S. Navy, who would sooner see the lifeboat sunk with Phillips inside than allow it to reach Somalia(n)

programme.title: Selma
programme.desc: David Oyelowo stars as Martin Luther King Jr. in this historical drama set during the height of the American civil-rights movement, and depicting the marches from Selma, AL, to the state capital of Montgomery to secure voting rights for black people. Brad Pitt and Oprah Winfrey produce and Ava DuVernay (I Will Follow, Middle of Nowhere) directs(n)

Season 5 ends with Leslie celebrating her first year as a city councilwoman; and Andy calling his alter ego, FBI agent Burt Macklin, out of retirement to help with an investigation. Elsewhere, April receives life-changing news; and Tom considers a big business opportunity(n)

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: London. In Part 1 of the two-part sixth-season opener, Leslie travels with Ben, Andy, April and Ron to London to accept an award. Back home, Tom is on the hunt for the mysterious businessman who's trying to shut down Rent a Swag, while Ann and Chris adjust to the next phase of their relationship(n)

programme.title: The Sitter
programme.desc: When reluctant babysitter Noah Griffith is invited to a party, he irresponsibly takes the kids along with him. But a run-in with a drug dealer soon turns their journey into the night from hell. Comedy(n)

programme.title: The Heat
programme.desc: A by-the-book FBI agent partners with an abrasive cop to take down a powerful drug lord(n)

programme.title: Dumb and Dumber To
programme.desc: Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels reprise their roles as lovable imbeciles Lloyd Christmas and Harry Dunne in this sequel to Dumb and Dumber from original directing duo Bobby and Peter Farrelly. The movie revisits the titular duo of dumb Harry (Daniels) and dumber Lloyd (Carrey), 20 years after the events of the first film: Harry pays his first visit to his parents since the early '90s, and discovers a two-decade-old postcard from a gal he hooked up with (Kathleen Turner) informing him that she's pregnant. It turns out she had a daughter and put the girl up for adoption. Harry is moved by the prospect of having an adult child out there somewhere (and it just so happens that he needs a kidney transplant), so he and Lloyd embark on a road trip to track down his daughter. They get mixed up in many wacky situations along the way, like finding and stealing their old "Shaggin' Wagon," and being duped into pleasuring an old lady in exchange for her hearing aids(n)

programme.title: Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2
programme.desc: Everyone's favorite bumbling mall cop returns in this sequel from Happy Madison and director Andy Fickman. Original Paul Blart: Mall Cop screenwriters Kevin James and Nick Bakay reteam to pen the script, which finds Paul Blart (James) and his daughter Maya in Las Vegas for a security-guard expo. When a band of menacing art thieves attempt a daring heist, Blart attempts to stop them with the help of the cynical casino security staff who once ridiculed him. Meanwhile, Blart contends with a crafty rival (Nicholas Turturro)(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Homer and Ned's Hail Mary Pass
programme.desc: Homer and Ned's Hail Mary Pass. Homer's victory dance at a carnival game leads to fame as a personal choreographer, and a gig producing the Super Bowl halftime show, with help from Flanders(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bonfire of the Manatees. Network premiere of the 17th series of The Simpsons. In the opening episode, Homer gets into trouble with the local mob over his gambling debts. To compensate them, he allows the mob to film an adult movie in his home - but keeps Marge in the dark about his plans. When Marge finds out, she goes ballistic, leaving Homer to look after the children while she goes on a trek to the beach. While by the sea, she meets Caleb Thorn (voiced by Alec Baldwin), a handsome marine biologist who has dedicated his life to saving manatees. Will Marge be wooed by Caleb? And can Homer win Marge back?(n)

Sci-fi adventure based on Jules Verne's novels, starring Vincent Price and Charles Bronson, with Henry Hull and Mary Webster.(n)

Sci-fi adventure based on Jules Verne's novel, starring Michael Craig, Herbert Lom, Joan Greenwood and Michael Callan, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen.(n)

programme.desc: A bumbling secret agent becomes Britain's leading spy following the assassination of all the country's other espionage experts. Single-handedly he sets out to unmask a mysterious villain responsible for stealing the Crown Jewels - but no one is prepared to believe a sinister billionaire is the culprit. Comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson, John Malkovich, Natalie Imbruglia and Ben Miller.(n)

He conceals his activities behind the normal facade of an all-American family man for years, keeping his wife and daughters in the dark about his deadly profession. Fact-based crime drama, starring Michael Shannon, Winona Ryder and Chris Evans.(n)

programme.desc: A nightclub owner has until dawn to pay his murdered brother's massive debts to ruthless gangsters. Crime comedy, starring Seann William Scott, Timm Sharp and Lou Diamond Phillips.(n)

programme.desc: Biopic of 1970s marijuana trafficker Howard Marks, whose inventive smuggling schemes made him a huge success in the drug trade, as well as leading to dealings with both the IRA and British Intelligence. However, his efforts to crack the American market look set to bring about his downfall. Starring Rhys Ifans, Chloe Sevigny and David Thewlis.(n)

programme.title: Stalag 17
programme.desc: The inmates of a German PoW camp are convinced there is a traitor in their midst when the guards seem to be forewarned of their escape attempts. An unassuming sergeant content to remain a captive until the end of the conflict becomes the focus of suspicion as mob mentality takes hold. Billy Wilder's Second World War drama, starring an Oscar-winning William Holden, with Don Taylor, Otto Preminger and Harvey Lembeck.(n)

programme.title: Santa Fe
programme.desc: A former Confederate soldier takes a job building the Santa Fe railroad after the end of the Civil War and tries to persuade his three brothers to join him, fearing they will otherwise fall into a life of crime owing to their enduring hatred of the North. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Jerome Courtland, Janis Carter and Peter Thompson.(n)

Only one contender can make it through to represent their region in the national finals and get the chance to cook at a banquet held in St Paul's Cathedral to mark the 70th anniversary of D-Day.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The first of the North East heats sees returning contender Colin McGurran and newcomers Paul Welburn and Frances Atkins prepare their starters for the D-Day banquet. They must impress a mystery Great British Menu veteran if they are to cook in the regional final for judges Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Molly Rose, who flew Spitfires for the Air Transport Auxiliary during the Second World War to support the RAF.(n)

programme.title: Ready Steady Cook
programme.desc: Actress Faith Brown and dress designer Scott Henshall compete in the culinary duel. Ainsley Harriott presents.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond's prepares chicken mozzarella pasta, shrimp scampi for her and the girls, pasta puttanesca for a solo meal and quick shells and cheese for the boys.(n)

programme.title: Chopped Junior
programme.desc: Spin-off from the cookery competition featuring young contestants.(n)

programme.title: Man Finds Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman visits Moscow, meeting a chef who only uses meat from animals he has hunted himself and sampling traditional chicken tkemali and beef stroganoff.(n)

programme.title: Man Finds Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman finds secret eats in Warsaw, including a take on Neapolitan pizza.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares dishes using strawberries grown in hanging baskets at his Essex plot. He uses the fruit to create a salad with speck and halloumi, rustles up a home-made jam to serve with a creamy rice pudding and presents his take on an old classic - grilled strawberries with Pimm's.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef prepares a selection of dishes using fresh peas and broad beans from his garden and demonstrates not only how easy they are to grow but also the bumper yield that can be achieved. He uses the vegetables as the final touches in a spaghetti and meatball dish, as well as creating `posh beans on toast' and a spicy fritter.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: This episode follows two chefs from Texas who love to get the barbecue. First, we meet Tom Spaulding, who serves classic Texas-style barbecue food.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Deep in the heart of Texas, Sandra Julian preserves the tradition of cowboy cuisine in her rustic chuck wagon, where she cooks her famous chicken fried steak.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The 1980s pop star Tiffany goes undercover as a Mystery Diner.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: Featuring the owner of Nashville Street Tacos and The Stillery.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel helps struggling restaurant owners deal with their unruly staff.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: When the owners of Indulge Bistro and Wine Bar in Colorado notice discrepancies in their food costs, they contact Charles Stiles for help.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: Jimmy, owner of Rockabillies, is concerned about a dip in sales, especially during his vintage car show. The Mystery Diners discover that his staff are breaking multiple rules.(n)

programme.title: The Piglet Files

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin's cricket team is a man short and he knows Paul is a very good player - as do the rest of the side and they all want him in, even if it means they can't play themselves. Can he bring himself to pick his arch-enemy? Comedy, starring Richard Briers and Paul Egan.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Following his departure to Bulgaria, news of Gordon Brittas' apparent death reaches his colleagues at Whitbury Leisure Centre. However, Brittas returns from the dead to cause havoc and Carole is determined to save her baby from his zombie. Comedy, starring Chris Barrie.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Variations on a Theme of Road Rage.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: In Which Howard Gets Double Booked.
programme.desc: Howard discovers he has mistakenly agreed to take Pearl and Marina out to dinner at the same time. Long-running comedy from the pen of Roy Clarke, starring Robert Fyfe, Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Will the Nearest Alien Please Come In?.
programme.desc: Truly, Clegg and Alvin try to convince science-fiction fanatic Kevin that aliens have landed nearby. Christmas edition of the long-running comedy from 1993, starring Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Mark Curry.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The disappearance of an illicit tin of pineapple chunks leaves the inmates horrified that there is a thief in their midst - and for a while, no one is above suspicion. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright's day turns into a nightmare when Nurse Gladys Emmanuel has a problem with her washing machine. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Lynda Baron.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: With Shazia and Amjad's wedding fast approaching, the Khans invite the Maliks over for dinner, concerned they have never hit it off with the groom's mother - and also hope Amjad's father can help Mr Khan get onto a business committee. They pull out all the stops to impress, with Mrs Khan cooking up a storm in the kitchen, parlour games being organised, Mr Khan buying a new suit, and the couple even having a new piece of furniture to show off. But then an unexpected phone call jeopardises the event. Adil Ray and Shobu Kapoor star, with guest appearances by Ted Robbins and Colin McFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: Basil goes to great lengths to prove to Sybil that a guest has smuggled a woman into his room. Instead the hotelier keeps being caught in compromising situations with a young Australian woman, and a visiting psychiatrist finds his increasingly manic behaviour both fascinating and alarming. Classic comedy first broadcast in 1979, starring John Cleese and Prunella Scales.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The couple announce their engagement, prompting the Shipmans to throw a party in Billericay. Even Bryn's decision to use his sat-nav for the journey fails to dampen their spirits, and everything goes swimmingly until the conversation turns to money - and the sweethearts drop a bombshell. Mathew Horne and Joanna Page star.(n)

programme.title: Outnumbered
programme.desc: The Brockmans have to make some tough decisions about work and video games, as well as who to take to a family funeral - an event that has the vicar wishing none of them had ever come. Comedy, starring Hugh Dennis, Claire Skinner and Tyger Drew-Honey.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The newlyweds return from their honeymoon to a big welcome from both their families. However, Smithy seems disconcerted by his pal's return and Nessa makes a confession that spoils the happy occasion. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne, James Corden and Joanna Page.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Lee Mack hosts the stand-up show from the Hammersmith Apollo, introducing guest Sean Lock. Topics discussed include Riverdance, cockneys and starfish.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Mark's plans for a productive week off are disrupted by the arrival of his sister - and he becomes annoyed as Jeremy develops a crush on her. The aspiring musician gets a taste of his own medicine, however, as his flatmate admits to having feelings for Big Suze. Robert Webb and David Mitchell star.(n)

programme.title: The Young Ones
programme.desc: The lads borrow a video recorder so they can watch some video nasties, only to end up being terrorised by a vampire driving instructor. Ben Elton's anarchic comedy, starring Rik Mayall, Adrian Edmondson, Nigel Planer and Christopher Ryan, and guest starring Terry Jones, Dawn French and punk band the Damned.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Lee Mack hosts the stand-up show from the Hammersmith Apollo, introducing guest Sean Lock. Topics discussed include Riverdance, cockneys and starfish.(n)

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.sub-title: The Black Adder: Born to Be King.
programme.desc: Fearsome Scottish warrior McAngus visits the castle while the King is away fighting in the crusades, and tries to take control of Edmund's lands. The conniving prince plots to have McAngus murdered, only to find the highlander may have useful information that could help him challenge his brother's legitimacy as heir to the throne.(n)

programme.title: Big School
programme.desc: An impromptu Ofsted inspection spreads panic throughout the staff at Greybridge, as the teachers worry about what a negative report could mean for their careers. With cheating at sports, ludicrously tight outfits and rampant bribery all considered fair game, it seems there's nothing they won't resort to when it comes to holding on to their jobs. For Ms Baron however, the main concern is whether the inspectors' presence will mean she isn't able to enjoy a bag of marijuana she has confiscated from a pupil. Guest star Sylvestra Le Touzel (Utopia) joins David Walliams, Catherine Tate and Philip Glenister in the classroom comedy.(n)

programme.title: The Smell of Reeves and Mortimer
programme.desc: Vic and Bob present their own brand of inimitable humour, including an unusual version of Noel's Addicts, and an appearance by Uncle Peter.(n)

programme.desc: Granville struggles to find some privacy when the milkwoman makes a pass at him. Nurse Gladys Emmanuel steps in by persuading Arkwright to take her to a hotel - but he cannot stop thinking about his business. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.(n)

programme.title: Citizen Khan
programme.desc: Mrs Khan announces she is running a stall at the city farm to promote the supermarket's new organic range, but her husband couldn't be less interested. He wants to know why he, of all people, hasn't been invited to a royal reception in Birmingham being attended by none other than Prince Charles. But then he hears His Royal Highness may be dropping in to the city farm, and he sees his chance - only to discover he still won't get anywhere near the future king unless he can impress the formidable head of the welcoming committee, Marina Fairchild (Belinda Lang, 2point4 Children).(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The remaining chefs are asked to prove their creativity, as judges Michel Roux Jr and Monica Galetti push them to the limits of their ability. The contestants have to prepare two dishes from left-overs including meat bones, chicken carcasses, fish trimmings, vegetable peelings, stale croissants and bread, and over-ripe fruit, with the judges sending one more chef home at the end.(n)

programme.title: Destination Flavour Japan
programme.desc: Adam Liaw heads to the Tohuku region, where he goes to sea with fishermen who caught a record-breaking tuna and meets the soy-sauce maker who saved many of his staff from the 2011 tsunami.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The quarter-final of the competition sees the remaining amateur bakers tackle biscuit-based challenges. Their first task involves making a large batch of crispbreads - each of which must come up to Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood's exacting standards - before the technical challenge, in which they battle time and temperature to create a set of six chocolate teacakes. The last round sees the hopefuls baking and assembling a gingerbread house, before Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins reveal who has qualified for the 2012 semi-final - and who is going home.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining five contestants enter the kitchens of Hever Castle, Kent, the childhood home of Anne Boleyn, where they cook a menu that pushes them to the limits of their abilities. With the assistance of chef John Campbell, they tackle one course each, which they have four hours to prepare, but must master elements of cuisine they have never attempted before. Their dishes are served to a group of historians - Mary Beard, Terry Deary and Lucy Worsley. Back in the studio, John Torode and Gregg Wallace set another invention test, although this time the choice of ingredients consists of scraps, leftovers and trimmings, including chicken giblets, bones, fish heads, potato peelings and stale bread. Will anyone make a pig's ear of it?.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers: Mums Know Best
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers celebrate traditional Sunday dinners, sampling the delights offered by a second-generation Italian living in east London. They also visit a mother and daughter who have come up with their own take on a regal classic, and meet a woman whose American husband relies on her culinary skill to provide him with a heart-warming taste of home.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Simple Suppers
programme.desc: The food writer shows how to make the most of simple ingredients as he prepares meatballs with grated beetroot and uses a small garden harvest to create a pudding. Nigel also continues visiting allotments around the country, and this time he heads to Kent, where he cooks vegetable fritters.(n)

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's Street Food Asia
programme.desc: Part two of two. Luke continues his Saigon adventure, uncovering a dispute between sisters with competing food stalls and cooking spicy chilli crab claws.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Korean Food Tour
programme.desc: New series. The masterful chef explores the wonders of Korean food. In Seoul, John discovers summer dishes and makes chicken ginseng soup and BBQ pork skewers.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The quarter-final of the competition sees the remaining amateur bakers tackle biscuit-based challenges. programme.title: James Martin: Home Comforts
programme.desc: The chef uses a selection of fragrant herbs and spices in his Hampshire kitchen, including basil and lavender, as he creates dishes infused with fresh, vibrant flavours. With food historian Ivan Day.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Simple Suppers
programme.desc: The food writer shows how to make the most of simple ingredients as he prepares meatballs with grated beetroot and uses a small garden harvest to create a pudding. Nigel also continues visiting allotments around the country, and this time he heads to Kent, where he cooks vegetable fritters.(n)

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's Street Food Asia
programme.desc: Part two of two. Luke continues his Saigon adventure, uncovering a dispute between sisters with competing food stalls and cooking spicy chilli crab claws.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Korean Food Tour
programme.desc: New series. The masterful chef explores the wonders of Korean food. In Seoul, John discovers summer dishes and makes chicken ginseng soup and BBQ pork skewers.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers: Mums Know Best
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers celebrate traditional Sunday dinners, sampling the delights offered by a second-generation Italian living in east London. They also visit a mother and daughter who have come up with their own take on a regal classic, and meet a woman whose American husband relies on her culinary skill to provide him with a heart-warming taste of home.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining five contestants enter the kitchens of Hever Castle, Kent, the childhood home of Anne Boleyn, where they cook a menu that pushes them to the limits of their abilities. With the assistance of chef John Campbell, they tackle one course each, which they have four hours to prepare, but must master elements of cuisine they have never attempted before. Their dishes are served to a group of historians - Mary Beard, Terry Deary and Lucy Worsley. Back in the studio, John Torode and Gregg Wallace set another invention test, although this time the choice of ingredients consists of scraps, leftovers and trimmings, including chicken giblets, bones, fish heads, potato peelings and stale bread. Will anyone make a pig's ear of it?.(n)

programme.title: James Martin: Home Comforts
programme.desc: The chef uses a selection of fragrant herbs and spices in his Hampshire kitchen, including basil and lavender, as he creates dishes infused with fresh, vibrant flavours. With food historian Ivan Day.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The quarter-final of the competition sees the remaining amateur bakers tackle biscuit-based challenges. Their first task involves making a large batch of crispbreads - each of which must come up to Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood's exacting standards - before the technical challenge, in which they battle time and temperature to create a set of six chocolate teacakes. The last round sees the hopefuls baking and assembling a gingerbread house, before Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins reveal who has qualified for the 2012 semi-final - and who is going home.(n)

The contestants have to prepare two dishes from left-overs including meat bones, chicken carcasses, fish trimmings, vegetable peelings, stale croissants and bread, and over-ripe fruit, with the judges sending one more chef home at the end.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The finalists visit Modena in Italy, where they are challenged to work under chef patron Massimo Bottura at the three Michelin-starred Osteria Francescana. They are then put in charge of two dishes each as they cook the restaurant's six-course tasting menu for the judges and a selection of guests, before returning to the MasterChef kitchens to prepare a dish influenced by their experiences.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Four bakers remain in the hunt for the title of Britain's best amateur baker, but they all need to raise their game when they tackle a trio of classic patisserie confections in the semi-final. A petits fours-making challenge provides an early test of nerves, before the quartet face the toughest technical task in the show's history - creating a fraisier, a sponge cake filled with mousse and strawberries. As tempers rise and confidence falters, the contestants have one last chance to impress judges Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry by baking a showstopping choux gateau - before discovering who has earned a place in the 2012 final. Presented by Sue Perkins and Mel Giedroyc.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The last of the semi-finals sees the five hopefuls facing one last challenge that could mean the difference between going home and winning a place in the final four. They have 75 minutes to create a dish for John Torode and Gregg Wallace that will ensure they move forward in the competition - and instead of walking the room as usual, the judges remove themselves to the dining area, unaware of what they are going to taste until it arrives on their table.(n)

programme.title: Sweet Baby James
programme.desc: Chef James Martin returns to the first restaurant at which he worked, London's 190 Queen's Gate - formerly run by Antony Worrall Thompson - where he shares pudding secrets with old colleagues. He also visits the Berkeley Hotel in Knightsbridge to sample afternoon tea with a modern twist, and investigates why traditional fruits are making a comeback.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers: Mums Know Best
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers track down traditional, yet flamboyant, recipes usually reserved for special occasions. They sample a Baltic take on a pig's trotters dish, try a lemon souffle said to be favoured by the royal family, and learn the secrets behind the perfect baked Alaska. The duo also demonstrate how to prepare a prized honey-glazed ham.(n)

programme.desc: George Clooney wears two hats, or in the case of this winning gridiron romp, one hat and one helmet, as both director and star. He plays Dodge Connolly, a 1920s pro-footballer who tries to save his floundering squad by signing a college star (John Krasinski) to help get the team on track and, more important, turn a profit. Renee Zellweger costars as a reporter who becomes the object of affection for both. Randy Newman, who composed the film score, has a cameo as a speakeasy piano player(n)

programme.title: Mr. Woodcock
programme.desc: John Farley (Sean William Scott) has overcome years of childhood and teenage humiliation and has fashioned himself into a self-help author who guides others towards releasing their painful memories and rebuilding their self-esteem. However, his miserable past sneaks up on him when he returns to his hometown only to find that his mother is marrying Mr. Woodcock (Billy Bob Thornton), the tough gym teacher who was the source of his school years' woes. Determined to stop his mother from marrying the man who made school a living hell for him, John is going to need all the self-help he can get. The cast of this outrageous comedy is rounded up by Susan Sarandon, Amy Poehler and Ethan Suplee(n)

programme.title: The Sweetest Thing
programme.desc: Cameron Diaz is delightful in this offbeat romantic comedy, which is brimming with outrageous gross-out humor. Diaz plays lovelorn club-hopper Christina Walters, who finally finds her Mr. Right in dashing Peter Donahue (Thomas Jane). programme.title: The Cider House Rules

programme.title: Leatherheads
programme.desc: George Clooney wears two hats, or in the case of this winning gridiron romp, one hat and one helmet, as both director and star. He plays Dodge Connolly, a 1920s pro-footballer who tries to save his floundering squad by signing a college star (John Krasinski) to help get the team on track and, more important, turn a profit. Renee Zellweger costars as a reporter who becomes the object of affection for both. Randy Newman, who composed the film score, has a cameo as a speakeasy piano player(n)

programme.title: Mr. Woodcock
programme.desc: John Farley (Sean William Scott) has overcome years of childhood and teenage humiliation and has fashioned himself into a self-help author who guides others towards releasing their painful memories and rebuilding their self-esteem. However, his miserable past sneaks up on him when he returns to his hometown only to find that his mother is marrying Mr. Woodcock (Billy Bob Thornton), the tough gym teacher who was the source of his school years' woes. Determined to stop his mother from marrying the man who made school a living hell for him, John is going to need all the self-help he can get. The cast of this outrageous comedy is rounded up by Susan Sarandon, Amy Poehler and Ethan Suplee(n)

programme.title: Shakespeare in Love
programme.desc: Tom Stoppard provided the witty and intelligent script for John Madden's romantic comedy in which young Will Shakespeare struggles with writer's block and money worries while trying to complete Romeo and Ethel: The Pirate's Daughter. Gwyneth Paltrow once more employs her faultless English accent, playing aristocratic Viola de Lesseps, who is shortly to be married off but yearns to slum it as an actor. Disguising herself as a boy in order to be allowed on stage, Viola becomes Will's muse, and the more familiar tale of Romeo and Juliet begins to take shape as the couple fall passionately in love. The film is littered with knowing lines and energetically supported by a stellar cast, including Judy Dench as Queen Elizabeth - a cameo performance which earned her one of the movie's seven Oscars(n)

programme.desc: Dragonstone. In the Season 7 premiere, Jon organizes the defense of the North; Cersei seeks to even the odds; and Daenerys comes home(n)

programme.title: Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Server Error. In the Series 4 finale, Richard's caught in a web of lies in a last-ditch attempt to save Pied Piper. Meanwhile, Jared plans his exit when he's worried about Richard's future; Jack tries to change the narrative; and Gavin plots his comeback(n)

programme.title: Harold & Kumar Escape From Guantanamo Bay
programme.desc: Kal Penn and John Cho return in this outrageous and unrated sequel. The pot-smoking slacker pals are suspected of being terrorists---and have more irreverent misadventures with Neil Patrick Harris. Rob Corddry, Roger Bart, David Krumholtz, Eddie Kaye Thomas. Written and directed by Jon Hurwitz and Hayden Schlossberg(n)
